31#include <sys/cdefs.h>
32__RCSID("$NetBSD: mdb.c,v 1.2 2018/04/07 22:37:30 christos Exp $");
33
34#include "dhcpd.h"
35#include "omapip/hash.h"
36
37struct subnet *subnets;
38struct shared_network *shared_networks;
39host_hash_t *host_hw_addr_hash;
40host_hash_t *host_uid_hash;
41host_hash_t *host_name_hash;
42lease_id_hash_t *lease_uid_hash;
43lease_ip_hash_t *lease_ip_addr_hash;
44lease_id_hash_t *lease_hw_addr_hash;
45
46/*
47 * We allow users to specify any option as a host identifier.
48 *
49 * Any host is uniquely identified by the combination of
50 * option type & option data.
51 *
52 * We expect people will only use a few types of options as host
53 * identifier. Because of this, we store a list with an entry for
54 * each option type. Each of these has a hash table, which contains
55 * hash of the option data.
56 *
57 * For v6 we also include a relay count - this specifies which
58 * relay to check for the requested option. As each different
59 * value of relays creates a new instance admins should use the
60 * same value across each option for all host-identifers.
61 * A value of 0 indicates that we aren't doing relay options
62 * and should simply look in the current option list.
63 */
64typedef struct host_id_info {
65 struct option *option;
66 host_hash_t *values_hash;
67 int relays;
68 struct host_id_info *next;
69} host_id_info_t;
70
71static host_id_info_t *host_id_info = NULL;
72
73int numclasseswritten;
74
75omapi_object_type_t *dhcp_type_host;
76
77isc_result_t enter_class(cd, dynamicp, commit)
78 struct class *cd;
79 int dynamicp;
80 int commit;
81{
82 if (!collections -> classes) {
83 /* A subclass with no parent is invalid. */
84 if (cd->name == NULL)
85 return DHCP_R_INVALIDARG;
86
87 class_reference (&collections -> classes, cd, MDL);
88 } else if (cd->name != NULL) { /* regular class */
89 struct class *c = 0;
90
91 if (find_class(&c, cd->name, MDL) != ISC_R_NOTFOUND) {
92 class_dereference(&c, MDL);
93 return ISC_R_EXISTS;
94 }
95
96 /* Find the tail. */
97 for (c = collections -> classes;
98 c -> nic; c = c -> nic)
99 /* nothing */ ;
100 class_reference (&c -> nic, cd, MDL);
101 }
102
103 if (dynamicp && commit) {
104 const char *name = cd->name;
105
106 if (name == NULL) {
107 name = cd->superclass->name;
108 }
109
110 write_named_billing_class ((const unsigned char *)name, 0, cd);
111 if (!commit_leases ())
112 return ISC_R_IOERROR;
113 }
114
115 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
116}
117
118
119/* Variable to check if we're starting the server. The server will init as
120 * starting - but just to be safe start out as false to avoid triggering new
121 * special-case code
122 * XXX: There is actually a server_startup state...which is never entered...
123 */
124#define SS_NOSYNC 1
125#define SS_QFOLLOW 2
126static int server_starting = 0;
127
128static int find_uid_statement (struct executable_statement *esp,
129 void *vp, int condp)
130{
131 struct executable_statement **evp = vp;
132
133 if (esp -> op == supersede_option_statement &&
134 esp -> data.option &&
135 (esp -> data.option -> option -> universe ==
136 &dhcp_universe) &&
137 (esp -> data.option -> option -> code ==
138 DHO_DHCP_CLIENT_IDENTIFIER)) {
139 if (condp) {
140 log_error ("dhcp client identifier may not be %s",
141 "specified conditionally.");
142 } else if (!(*evp)) {
143 executable_statement_reference (evp, esp, MDL);
144 return 1;
145 } else {
146 log_error ("only one dhcp client identifier may be %s",
147 "specified");
148 }
149 }
150 return 0;
151}
152
153
154static host_id_info_t *
155find_host_id_info(unsigned int option_code, int relays) {
156 host_id_info_t *p;
157
158 for (p = host_id_info; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
159 if ((p->option->code == option_code) &&
160 (p->relays == relays)) {
161 break;
162 }
163 }
164 return p;
165}

172 printf("--------------\n");
173 printf("name:'%s'\n", print_hex_1(len, name, 60));
174 printf("len:%d\n", len);

176 printf("host @%p is '%s'\n", h, h->name);
177 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;

180void
181hash_print_hosts(struct hash_table *h) {
182 hash_foreach(h, print_host);
183 printf("--------------\n");
184}

186
187void
188change_host_uid(struct host_decl *host, const char *uid, int len) {
189 /* XXX: should consolidate this type of code throughout */
190 if (host_uid_hash == NULL) {
191 if (!host_new_hash(&host_uid_hash, HOST_HASH_SIZE, MDL)) {
192 log_fatal("Can't allocate host/uid hash");
193 }
194 }
195
196 /*
197 * Remove the old entry, if one exists.
198 */
199 if (host->client_identifier.data != NULL) {
200 host_hash_delete(host_uid_hash,
201 host->client_identifier.data,
202 host->client_identifier.len,
203 MDL);
204 data_string_forget(&host->client_identifier, MDL);
205 }
206
207 /*
208 * Set our new value.
209 */
210 memset(&host->client_identifier, 0, sizeof(host->client_identifier));
211 host->client_identifier.len = len;
212 if (!buffer_allocate(&host->client_identifier.buffer, len, MDL)) {
213 log_fatal("Can't allocate uid buffer");
214 }
215 host->client_identifier.data = host->client_identifier.buffer->data;
216 memcpy((char *)host->client_identifier.data, uid, len);
217
218 /*
219 * And add to hash.
220 */
221 host_hash_add(host_uid_hash, host->client_identifier.data,
222 host->client_identifier.len, host, MDL);
223}
224
225isc_result_t enter_host (hd, dynamicp, commit)
226 struct host_decl *hd;
227 int dynamicp;
228 int commit;
229{
230 struct host_decl *hp = (struct host_decl *)0;
231 struct host_decl *np = (struct host_decl *)0;
232 struct executable_statement *esp;
233 host_id_info_t *h_id_info;
234
235 if (!host_name_hash) {
236 if (!host_new_hash(&host_name_hash, HOST_HASH_SIZE, MDL))
237 log_fatal ("Can't allocate host name hash");
238 host_hash_add (host_name_hash,
239 (unsigned char *)hd -> name,
240 strlen (hd -> name), hd, MDL);
241 } else {
242 host_hash_lookup (&hp, host_name_hash,
243 (unsigned char *)hd -> name,
244 strlen (hd -> name), MDL);
245
246 /* If it's deleted, we can supersede it. */
247 if (hp && (hp -> flags & HOST_DECL_DELETED)) {
248 host_hash_delete (host_name_hash,
249 (unsigned char *)hd -> name,
250 strlen (hd -> name), MDL);
251 /* If the old entry wasn't dynamic, then we
252 always have to keep the deletion. */
253 if (hp -> flags & HOST_DECL_STATIC) {
254 hd -> flags |= HOST_DECL_STATIC;
255 }
256 host_dereference (&hp, MDL);
257 }
258
259 /* If we are updating an existing host declaration, we
260 can just delete it and add it again. */
261 if (hp && hp == hd) {
262 host_dereference (&hp, MDL);
263 delete_host (hd, 0);
264 if (!write_host (hd))
265 return ISC_R_IOERROR;
266 hd -> flags &= ~HOST_DECL_DELETED;
267 }
268
269 /* If there isn't already a host decl matching this
270 address, add it to the hash table. */
271 if (!hp) {
272 host_hash_add (host_name_hash,
273 (unsigned char *)hd -> name,
274 strlen (hd -> name), hd, MDL);
275 } else {
276 /* XXX actually, we have to delete the old one
277 XXX carefully and replace it. Not done yet. */
278 host_dereference (&hp, MDL);
279 return ISC_R_EXISTS;
280 }
281 }
282
283 if (hd -> n_ipaddr)
284 host_dereference (&hd -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
285
286 if (!hd -> type)
287 hd -> type = dhcp_type_host;
288
289 if (hd -> interface.hlen) {
290 if (!host_hw_addr_hash) {
291 if (!host_new_hash(&host_hw_addr_hash,
292 HOST_HASH_SIZE, MDL))
293 log_fatal ("Can't allocate host/hw hash");
294 } else {
295 /* If there isn't already a host decl matching this
296 address, add it to the hash table. */
297 host_hash_lookup (&hp, host_hw_addr_hash,
298 hd -> interface.hbuf,
299 hd -> interface.hlen, MDL);
300 }
301 if (!hp)
302 host_hash_add (host_hw_addr_hash, hd -> interface.hbuf,
303 hd -> interface.hlen, hd, MDL);
304 else {
305 /* If there was already a host declaration for
306 this hardware address, add this one to the
307 end of the list. */
308 for (np = hp; np -> n_ipaddr; np = np -> n_ipaddr)
309 ;
310 host_reference (&np -> n_ipaddr, hd, MDL);
311 host_dereference (&hp, MDL);
312 }
313 }
314
315 /* See if there's a statement that sets the client identifier.
316 This is a kludge - the client identifier really shouldn't be
317 set with an executable statement. */
318 esp = NULL;
319 if (executable_statement_foreach (hd->group->statements,
320 find_uid_statement, &esp, 0)) {
321 (void) evaluate_option_cache (&hd->client_identifier,
322 NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL,
323 &global_scope,
324 esp->data.option, MDL);
325 }
326
327 /* If we got a client identifier, hash this entry by
328 client identifier. */
329 if (hd -> client_identifier.len) {
330 /* If there's no uid hash, make one; otherwise, see if
331 there's already an entry in the hash for this host. */
332 if (!host_uid_hash) {
333 if (!host_new_hash(&host_uid_hash,
334 HOST_HASH_SIZE, MDL))
335 log_fatal ("Can't allocate host/uid hash");
336
337 host_hash_add (host_uid_hash,
338 hd -> client_identifier.data,
339 hd -> client_identifier.len,
340 hd, MDL);
341 } else {
342 /* If there's already a host declaration for this
343 client identifier, add this one to the end of the
344 list. Otherwise, add it to the hash table. */
345 if (host_hash_lookup (&hp, host_uid_hash,
346 hd -> client_identifier.data,
347 hd -> client_identifier.len,
348 MDL)) {
349 /* Don't link it in twice... */
350 if (!np) {
351 for (np = hp; np -> n_ipaddr;
352 np = np -> n_ipaddr) {
353 if (hd == np)
354 break;
355 }
356 if (hd != np)
357 host_reference (&np -> n_ipaddr,
358 hd, MDL);
359 }
360 host_dereference (&hp, MDL);
361 } else {
362 host_hash_add (host_uid_hash,
363 hd -> client_identifier.data,
364 hd -> client_identifier.len,
365 hd, MDL);
366 }
367 }
368 }
369
370
371 /*
372 * If we use an option as our host identifier, record it here.
373 */
374 if (hd->host_id_option != NULL) {
375 /*
376 * Look for the host identifier information for this option,
377 * and create a new entry if there is none.
378 */
379 h_id_info = find_host_id_info(hd->host_id_option->code,
380 hd->relays);
381 if (h_id_info == NULL) {
382 h_id_info = dmalloc(sizeof(*h_id_info), MDL);
383 if (h_id_info == NULL) {
384 log_fatal("No memory for host-identifier "
385 "option information.");
386 }
387 option_reference(&h_id_info->option,
388 hd->host_id_option, MDL);
389 if (!host_new_hash(&h_id_info->values_hash,
390 HOST_HASH_SIZE, MDL)) {
391 log_fatal("No memory for host-identifier "
392 "option hash.");
393 }
394 h_id_info->relays = hd->relays;
395 h_id_info->next = host_id_info;
396 host_id_info = h_id_info;
397 }
398
399 if (host_hash_lookup(&hp, h_id_info->values_hash,
400 hd->host_id.data, hd->host_id.len, MDL)) {
401 /*
402 * If this option is already present, then add
403 * this host to the list in n_ipaddr, unless
404 * we have already done so previously.
405 *
406 * XXXSK: This seems scary to me, but I don't
407 * fully understand how these are used.
408 * Shouldn't there be multiple lists, or
409 * maybe we should just forbid duplicates?
410 */
411 if (np == NULL) {
412 np = hp;
413 while (np->n_ipaddr != NULL) {
414 np = np->n_ipaddr;
415 }
416 if (hd != np) {
417 host_reference(&np->n_ipaddr, hd, MDL);
418 }
419 }
420 host_dereference(&hp, MDL);
421 } else {
422 host_hash_add(h_id_info->values_hash,
423 hd->host_id.data,
424 hd->host_id.len,
425 hd, MDL);
426 }
427 }
428
429 if (dynamicp && commit) {
430 if (!write_host (hd))
431 return ISC_R_IOERROR;
432 if (!commit_leases ())
433 return ISC_R_IOERROR;
434 }
435
436 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
437}
438
439
440isc_result_t delete_class (cp, commit)
441 struct class *cp;
442 int commit;
443{
444 cp->flags |= CLASS_DECL_DELETED;
445
446 /* do the write first as we won't be leaving it in any data
447 structures, unlike the host objects */
448
449 if (commit) {
450 write_named_billing_class ((unsigned char *)cp->name, 0, cp);
451 if (!commit_leases ())
452 return ISC_R_IOERROR;
453 }
454
455 /*
456 * If this is a subclass remove it from the class's hash table
457 */
458 if (cp->superclass) {
459 class_hash_delete(cp->superclass->hash,
460 (const char *)cp->hash_string.data,
461 cp->hash_string.len,
462 MDL);
463 }
464
465 /* remove from collections */
466 unlink_class(&cp);
467
468 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
469}
470
471
472isc_result_t delete_host (hd, commit)
473 struct host_decl *hd;
474 int commit;
475{
476 struct host_decl *hp = (struct host_decl *)0;
477 struct host_decl *np = (struct host_decl *)0;
478 struct host_decl *foo;
479 int hw_head = 0, uid_head = 1;
480
481 /* Don't need to do it twice. */
482 if (hd -> flags & HOST_DECL_DELETED)
483 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
484
485 /* But we do need to do it once! :') */
486 hd -> flags |= HOST_DECL_DELETED;
487
488 if (hd -> interface.hlen) {
489 if (host_hw_addr_hash) {
490 if (host_hash_lookup (&hp, host_hw_addr_hash,
491 hd -> interface.hbuf,
492 hd -> interface.hlen, MDL)) {
493 if (hp == hd) {
494 host_hash_delete (host_hw_addr_hash,
495 hd -> interface.hbuf,
496 hd -> interface.hlen, MDL);
497 hw_head = 1;
498 } else {
499 np = (struct host_decl *)0;
500 foo = (struct host_decl *)0;
501 host_reference (&foo, hp, MDL);
502 while (foo) {
503 if (foo == hd)
504 break;
505 if (np)
506 host_dereference (&np, MDL);
507 host_reference (&np, foo, MDL);
508 host_dereference (&foo, MDL);
509 if (np -> n_ipaddr)
510 host_reference (&foo, np -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
511 }
512
513 if (foo) {
514 host_dereference (&np -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
515 if (hd -> n_ipaddr)
516 host_reference (&np -> n_ipaddr,
517 hd -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
518 host_dereference (&foo, MDL);
519 }
520 if (np)
521 host_dereference (&np, MDL);
522 }
523 host_dereference (&hp, MDL);
524 }
525 }
526 }
527
528 /* If we got a client identifier, hash this entry by
529 client identifier. */
530 if (hd -> client_identifier.len) {
531 if (host_uid_hash) {
532 if (host_hash_lookup (&hp, host_uid_hash,
533 hd -> client_identifier.data,
534 hd -> client_identifier.len, MDL)) {
535 if (hp == hd) {
536 host_hash_delete (host_uid_hash,
537 hd -> client_identifier.data,
538 hd -> client_identifier.len, MDL);
539 uid_head = 1;
540 } else {
541 np = (struct host_decl *)0;
542 foo = (struct host_decl *)0;
543 host_reference (&foo, hp, MDL);
544 while (foo) {
545 if (foo == hd)
546 break;
547 if (np)
548 host_dereference (&np, MDL);
549 host_reference (&np, foo, MDL);
550 host_dereference (&foo, MDL);
551 if (np -> n_ipaddr)
552 host_reference (&foo, np -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
553 }
554
555 if (foo) {
556 host_dereference (&np -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
557 if (hd -> n_ipaddr)
558 host_reference (&np -> n_ipaddr,
559 hd -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
560 host_dereference (&foo, MDL);
561 }
562 if (np)
563 host_dereference (&np, MDL);
564 }
565 host_dereference (&hp, MDL);
566 }
567 }
568 }
569
570 if (hd->host_id_option != NULL) {
571 option_dereference(&hd->host_id_option, MDL);
572 data_string_forget(&hd->host_id, MDL);
573 }
574
575 if (hd -> n_ipaddr) {
576 if (uid_head && hd -> n_ipaddr -> client_identifier.len) {
577 host_hash_add
578 (host_uid_hash,
579 hd -> n_ipaddr -> client_identifier.data,
580 hd -> n_ipaddr -> client_identifier.len,
581 hd -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
582 }
583 if (hw_head && hd -> n_ipaddr -> interface.hlen) {
584 host_hash_add (host_hw_addr_hash,
585 hd -> n_ipaddr -> interface.hbuf,
586 hd -> n_ipaddr -> interface.hlen,
587 hd -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
588 }
589 host_dereference (&hd -> n_ipaddr, MDL);
590 }
591
592 if (host_name_hash) {
593 if (host_hash_lookup (&hp, host_name_hash,
594 (unsigned char *)hd -> name,
595 strlen (hd -> name), MDL)) {
596 if (hp == hd && !(hp -> flags & HOST_DECL_STATIC)) {
597 host_hash_delete (host_name_hash,
598 (unsigned char *)hd -> name,
599 strlen (hd -> name), MDL);
600 }
601 host_dereference (&hp, MDL);
602 }
603 }
604
605 if (commit) {
606 if (!write_host (hd))
607 return ISC_R_IOERROR;
608 if (!commit_leases ())
609 return ISC_R_IOERROR;
610 }
611 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
612}
613
614int find_hosts_by_haddr (struct host_decl **hp, int htype,
615 const unsigned char *haddr, unsigned hlen,
616 const char *file, int line)
617{
618 struct hardware h;
619#if defined(LDAP_CONFIGURATION)
620 int ret;
621
622 if ((ret = find_haddr_in_ldap (hp, htype, hlen, haddr, file, line)))
623 return ret;
624#endif
625
626 h.hlen = hlen + 1;
627 h.hbuf [0] = htype;
628 memcpy (&h.hbuf [1], haddr, hlen);
629
630 return host_hash_lookup (hp, host_hw_addr_hash,
631 h.hbuf, h.hlen, file, line);
632}
633
634int find_hosts_by_uid (struct host_decl **hp,
635 const unsigned char *data, unsigned len,
636 const char *file, int line)
637{
638 return host_hash_lookup (hp, host_uid_hash, data, len, file, line);
639}
640
641int
642find_hosts_by_option(struct host_decl **hp,
643 struct packet *packet,
644 struct option_state *opt_state,
645 const char *file, int line) {
646 host_id_info_t *p;
647 struct option_cache *oc;
648 struct data_string data;
649 int found;
650 struct packet *relay_packet;
651 struct option_state *relay_state;
652
653#if defined(LDAP_CONFIGURATION)
654 if ((found = find_client_in_ldap (hp, packet, opt_state, file, line)))
655 return found;
656#endif
657
658 for (p = host_id_info; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
659 relay_packet = packet;
660 relay_state = opt_state;
661
662 /* If this option block is for a relay (relays != 0)
663 * and we are processing the main options and not
664 * options from the IA (packet->options == opt_state)
665 * try to find the proper relay
666 */
667 if ((p->relays != 0) && (packet->options == opt_state)) {
668 int i = p->relays;
669 while ((i != 0) &&
670 (relay_packet->dhcpv6_container_packet != NULL)) {
671 relay_packet =
672 relay_packet->dhcpv6_container_packet;
673 i--;
674 }
675 /* We wanted a specific relay but were
676 * unable to find it */
677 if ((p->relays <= MAX_V6RELAY_HOPS) && (i != 0))
678 continue;
679
680 relay_state = relay_packet->options;
681 }
682
683 oc = lookup_option(p->option->universe,
684 relay_state, p->option->code);
685 if (oc != NULL) {
686 memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
687
688 if (!evaluate_option_cache(&data, relay_packet, NULL,
689 NULL, relay_state, NULL,
690 &global_scope, oc,
691 MDL)) {
692 log_error("Error evaluating option cache");
693 return 0;
694 }
695
696 found = host_hash_lookup(hp, p->values_hash,
697 data.data, data.len,
698 file, line);
699
700 data_string_forget(&data, MDL);
701
702 if (found) {
703 return 1;
704 }
705 }
706 }
707 return 0;
708}
709
710/* More than one host_decl can be returned by find_hosts_by_haddr or
711 find_hosts_by_uid, and each host_decl can have multiple addresses.
712 Loop through the list of hosts, and then for each host, through the
713 list of addresses, looking for an address that's in the same shared
714 network as the one specified. Store the matching address through
715 the addr pointer, update the host pointer to point at the host_decl
716 that matched, and return the subnet that matched. */
717
718int find_host_for_network (struct subnet **sp, struct host_decl **host,
719 struct iaddr *addr, struct shared_network *share)
720{
721 int i;
722 struct iaddr ip_address;
723 struct host_decl *hp;
724 struct data_string fixed_addr;
725
726 memset (&fixed_addr, 0, sizeof fixed_addr);
727
728 for (hp = *host; hp; hp = hp -> n_ipaddr) {
729 if (!hp -> fixed_addr)
730 continue;
731 if (!evaluate_option_cache (&fixed_addr, (struct packet *)0,
732 (struct lease *)0,
733 (struct client_state *)0,
734 (struct option_state *)0,
735 (struct option_state *)0,
736 &global_scope,
737 hp -> fixed_addr, MDL))
738 continue;
739 for (i = 0; i < fixed_addr.len; i += 4) {
740 ip_address.len = 4;
741 memcpy (ip_address.iabuf,
742 fixed_addr.data + i, 4);
743 if (find_grouped_subnet (sp, share, ip_address, MDL)) {
744 struct host_decl *tmp = (struct host_decl *)0;
745 *addr = ip_address;
746 /* This is probably not necessary, but
747 just in case *host is the only reference
748 to that host declaration, make a temporary
749 reference so that dereferencing it doesn't
750 dereference hp out from under us. */
751 host_reference (&tmp, *host, MDL);
752 host_dereference (host, MDL);
753 host_reference (host, hp, MDL);
754 host_dereference (&tmp, MDL);
755 data_string_forget (&fixed_addr, MDL);
756 return 1;
757 }
758 }
759 data_string_forget (&fixed_addr, MDL);
760 }
761 return 0;
762}
763
764void new_address_range (cfile, low, high, subnet, pool, lpchain)
765 struct parse *cfile;
766 struct iaddr low, high;
767 struct subnet *subnet;
768 struct pool *pool;
769 struct lease **lpchain;
770{
771#if defined(COMPACT_LEASES)
772 struct lease *address_range;
773 unsigned s;
774#endif
775 unsigned min, max, i, num_addrs;
776 char lowbuf [16], highbuf [16], netbuf [16];
777 struct shared_network *share = subnet -> shared_network;
778 struct lease *lt = (struct lease *)0;
779#if !defined(COMPACT_LEASES)
780 isc_result_t status;
781#endif
782
783 /* All subnets should have attached shared network structures. */
784 if (!share) {
785 strcpy (netbuf, piaddr (subnet -> net));
786 log_fatal ("No shared network for network %s (%s)",
787 netbuf, piaddr (subnet -> netmask));
788 }
789
790 /* Initialize the hash table if it hasn't been done yet. */
791 if (!lease_uid_hash) {
792 if (!lease_id_new_hash(&lease_uid_hash, LEASE_HASH_SIZE, MDL))
793 log_fatal ("Can't allocate lease/uid hash");
794 }
795 if (!lease_ip_addr_hash) {
796 if (!lease_ip_new_hash(&lease_ip_addr_hash, LEASE_HASH_SIZE,
797 MDL))
798 log_fatal ("Can't allocate lease/ip hash");
799 }
800 if (!lease_hw_addr_hash) {
801 if (!lease_id_new_hash(&lease_hw_addr_hash, LEASE_HASH_SIZE,
802 MDL))
803 log_fatal ("Can't allocate lease/hw hash");
804 }
805
806 /* Make sure that high and low addresses are in this subnet. */
807 if (!addr_eq(subnet->net, subnet_number(low, subnet->netmask))) {
808 strcpy(lowbuf, piaddr(low));
809 strcpy(netbuf, piaddr(subnet->net));
810 log_fatal("bad range, address %s not in subnet %s netmask %s",
811 lowbuf, netbuf, piaddr(subnet->netmask));
812 }
813
814 if (!addr_eq(subnet->net, subnet_number(high, subnet->netmask))) {
815 strcpy(highbuf, piaddr(high));
816 strcpy(netbuf, piaddr(subnet->net));
817 log_fatal("bad range, address %s not in subnet %s netmask %s",
818 highbuf, netbuf, piaddr(subnet->netmask));
819 }
820
821 /* Get the high and low host addresses... */
822 max = host_addr (high, subnet -> netmask);
823 min = host_addr (low, subnet -> netmask);
824
825 /* Allow range to be specified high-to-low as well as low-to-high. */
826 if (min > max) {
827 max = min;
828 min = host_addr (high, subnet -> netmask);
829 }
830
831 /* get the number of addresses we want, and add it to the pool info
832 * this value is only for use when setting up lease chains and will
833 * be overwritten when expire_all_pools is run
834 */
835 num_addrs = max - min + 1;
836#if defined (BINARY_LEASES)
837 pool->lease_count += num_addrs;
838#endif
839
840 /* Get a lease structure for each address in the range. */
841#if defined (COMPACT_LEASES)
842 s = (num_addrs + 1) * sizeof (struct lease);
843 /* Check unsigned overflow in new_leases().
844 With 304 byte lease structure (x64_86), this happens at
845 range 10.0.0.0 10.215.148.52; */
846 if (((s % sizeof (struct lease)) != 0) ||
847 ((s / sizeof (struct lease)) != (num_addrs + 1))) {
848 strcpy (lowbuf, piaddr (low));
849 strcpy (highbuf, piaddr (high));
850 parse_warn (cfile, "%s-%s is an overly large address range.",
851 lowbuf, highbuf);
852 log_fatal ("Memory overflow.");
853 }
854 address_range = new_leases (num_addrs, MDL);
855 if (!address_range) {
856 strcpy (lowbuf, piaddr (low));
857 strcpy (highbuf, piaddr (high));
858 log_fatal ("No memory for address range %s-%s.",
859 lowbuf, highbuf);
860 }
861#endif
862
863 /* Fill out the lease structures with some minimal information. */
864 for (i = 0; i < num_addrs; i++) {
865 struct lease *lp = (struct lease *)0;
866#if defined (COMPACT_LEASES)
867 omapi_object_initialize ((omapi_object_t *)&address_range [i],
868 dhcp_type_lease,
869 0, sizeof (struct lease), MDL);
870 lease_reference (&lp, &address_range [i], MDL);
871#else
872 status = lease_allocate (&lp, MDL);
873 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
874 log_fatal ("No memory for lease %s: %s",
875 piaddr (ip_addr (subnet -> net,
876 subnet -> netmask,
877 i + min)),
878 isc_result_totext (status));
879#endif
880 lp->ip_addr = ip_addr(subnet->net, subnet->netmask, i + min);
881 lp->starts = MIN_TIME;
882 lp->ends = MIN_TIME;
883 subnet_reference(&lp->subnet, subnet, MDL);
884 pool_reference(&lp->pool, pool, MDL);
885 lp->binding_state = FTS_FREE;
886 lp->next_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
887 lp->rewind_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
888 lp->flags = 0;
889
890 /* Remember the lease in the IP address hash. */
891 if (find_lease_by_ip_addr (&lt, lp -> ip_addr, MDL)) {
892 if (lt -> pool) {
893 parse_warn (cfile,
894 "lease %s is declared twice!",
895 piaddr (lp -> ip_addr));
896 } else
897 pool_reference (&lt -> pool, pool, MDL);
898 lease_dereference (&lt, MDL);
899 } else
900 lease_ip_hash_add(lease_ip_addr_hash,
901 lp->ip_addr.iabuf, lp->ip_addr.len,
902 lp, MDL);
903 /* Put the lease on the chain for the caller. */
904 if (lpchain) {
905 if (*lpchain) {
906 lease_reference (&lp -> next, *lpchain, MDL);
907 lease_dereference (lpchain, MDL);
908 }
909 lease_reference (lpchain, lp, MDL);
910 }
911 lease_dereference (&lp, MDL);
912 }
913}
914
915int find_subnet (struct subnet **sp,
916 struct iaddr addr, const char *file, int line)
917{
918 struct subnet *rv;
919
920 for (rv = subnets; rv; rv = rv -> next_subnet) {
921#if defined(DHCP4o6)
922 if (addr.len != rv->netmask.len)
923 continue;
924#endif
925 if (addr_eq (subnet_number (addr, rv -> netmask), rv -> net)) {
926 if (subnet_reference (sp, rv,
927 file, line) != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
928 return 0;
929 return 1;
930 }
931 }
932 return 0;
933}
934
935int find_grouped_subnet (struct subnet **sp,
936 struct shared_network *share, struct iaddr addr,
937 const char *file, int line)
938{
939 struct subnet *rv;
940
941 for (rv = share -> subnets; rv; rv = rv -> next_sibling) {
942#if defined(DHCP4o6)
943 if (addr.len != rv->netmask.len)
944 continue;
945#endif
946 if (addr_eq (subnet_number (addr, rv -> netmask), rv -> net)) {
947 if (subnet_reference (sp, rv,
948 file, line) != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
949 return 0;
950 return 1;
951 }
952 }
953 return 0;
954}
955
956/* XXX: could speed up if everyone had a prefix length */
957int
958subnet_inner_than(const struct subnet *subnet,
959 const struct subnet *scan,
960 int warnp) {
961#if defined(DHCP4o6)
962 if (subnet->net.len != scan->net.len)
963 return 0;
964#endif
965 if (addr_eq(subnet_number(subnet->net, scan->netmask), scan->net) ||
966 addr_eq(subnet_number(scan->net, subnet->netmask), subnet->net)) {
967 char n1buf[sizeof("ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:255.255.255")];
968 int i, j;
969 for (i = 0; i < 128; i++)
970 if (subnet->netmask.iabuf[3 - (i >> 3)]
971 & (1 << (i & 7)))
972 break;
973 for (j = 0; j < 128; j++)
974 if (scan->netmask.iabuf[3 - (j >> 3)] &
975 (1 << (j & 7)))
976 break;
977 if (warnp) {
978 strcpy(n1buf, piaddr(subnet->net));
979 log_error("Warning: subnet %s/%d overlaps subnet %s/%d",
980 n1buf, 32 - i,
981 piaddr(scan->net), 32 - j);
982 }
983 if (i < j)
984 return 1;
985 }
986 return 0;
987}
988
989/* Enter a new subnet into the subnet list. */
990void enter_subnet (subnet)
991 struct subnet *subnet;
992{
993 struct subnet *scan = (struct subnet *)0;
994 struct subnet *next = (struct subnet *)0;
995 struct subnet *prev = (struct subnet *)0;
996
997 /* Check for duplicates... */
998 if (subnets)
999 subnet_reference (&next, subnets, MDL);
1000 while (next) {
1001 subnet_reference (&scan, next, MDL);
1002 subnet_dereference (&next, MDL);
1003
1004 /* When we find a conflict, make sure that the
1005 subnet with the narrowest subnet mask comes
1006 first. */
1007 if (subnet_inner_than (subnet, scan, 1)) {
1008 if (prev) {
1009 if (prev -> next_subnet)
1010 subnet_dereference (&prev -> next_subnet, MDL);
1011 subnet_reference (&prev -> next_subnet, subnet, MDL);
1012 subnet_dereference (&prev, MDL);
1013 } else {
1014 subnet_dereference (&subnets, MDL);
1015 subnet_reference (&subnets, subnet, MDL);
1016 }
1017 subnet_reference (&subnet -> next_subnet, scan, MDL);
1018 subnet_dereference (&scan, MDL);
1019 return;
1020 }
1021 subnet_reference (&prev, scan, MDL);
1022 subnet_dereference (&scan, MDL);
1023 }
1024 if (prev)
1025 subnet_dereference (&prev, MDL);
1026
1027 /* XXX use the BSD radix tree code instead of a linked list. */
1028 if (subnets) {
1029 subnet_reference (&subnet -> next_subnet, subnets, MDL);
1030 subnet_dereference (&subnets, MDL);
1031 }
1032 subnet_reference (&subnets, subnet, MDL);
1033}
1034
1035/* Enter a new shared network into the shared network list. */
1036
1037void enter_shared_network (share)
1038 struct shared_network *share;
1039{
1040 if (shared_networks) {
1041 shared_network_reference (&share -> next,
1042 shared_networks, MDL);
1043 shared_network_dereference (&shared_networks, MDL);
1044 }
1045 shared_network_reference (&shared_networks, share, MDL);
1046}
1047
1048void new_shared_network_interface (cfile, share, name)
1049 struct parse *cfile;
1050 struct shared_network *share;
1051 const char *name;
1052{
1053 struct interface_info *ip;
1054 isc_result_t status;
1055
1056 if (share -> interface) {
1057 parse_warn (cfile,
1058 "A subnet or shared network can't be connected %s",
1059 "to two interfaces.");
1060 return;
1061 }
1062
1063 for (ip = interfaces; ip; ip = ip -> next)
1064 if (!strcmp (ip -> name, name))
1065 break;
1066 if (!ip) {
1067 status = interface_allocate (&ip, MDL);
1068 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1069 log_fatal ("new_shared_network_interface %s: %s",
1070 name, isc_result_totext (status));
1071 if (strlen (name) > sizeof ip -> name) {
1072 memcpy (ip -> name, name, (sizeof ip -> name) - 1);
1073 ip -> name [(sizeof ip -> name) - 1] = 0;
1074 } else
1075 strcpy (ip -> name, name);
1076 if (interfaces) {
1077 interface_reference (&ip -> next, interfaces, MDL);
1078 interface_dereference (&interfaces, MDL);
1079 }
1080 interface_reference (&interfaces, ip, MDL);
1081 ip -> flags = INTERFACE_REQUESTED;
1082 /* XXX this is a reference loop. */
1083 shared_network_reference (&ip -> shared_network, share, MDL);
1084 interface_reference (&share -> interface, ip, MDL);
1085 }
1086}
1087
1088/* Enter a lease into the system. This is called by the parser each
1089 time it reads in a new lease. If the subnet for that lease has
1090 already been read in (usually the case), just update that lease;
1091 otherwise, allocate temporary storage for the lease and keep it around
1092 until we're done reading in the config file. */
1093
1094void enter_lease (lease)
1095 struct lease *lease;
1096{
1097 struct lease *comp = (struct lease *)0;
1098
1099 if (find_lease_by_ip_addr (&comp, lease -> ip_addr, MDL)) {
1100 if (!comp -> pool) {
1101 log_error ("undeclared lease found in database: %s",
1102 piaddr (lease -> ip_addr));
1103 } else
1104 pool_reference (&lease -> pool, comp -> pool, MDL);
1105
1106 if (comp -> subnet)
1107 subnet_reference (&lease -> subnet,
1108 comp -> subnet, MDL);
1109 lease_ip_hash_delete(lease_ip_addr_hash,
1110 lease->ip_addr.iabuf, lease->ip_addr.len,
1111 MDL);
1112 lease_dereference (&comp, MDL);
1113 }
1114
1115 /* The only way a lease can get here without a subnet is if it's in
1116 the lease file, but not in the dhcpd.conf file. In this case, we
1117 *should* keep it around until it's expired, but never reallocate it
1118 or renew it. Currently, to maintain consistency, we are not doing
1119 this.
1120 XXX fix this so that the lease is kept around until it expires.
1121 XXX this will be important in IPv6 with addresses that become
1122 XXX non-renewable as a result of a renumbering event. */
1123
1124 if (!lease -> subnet) {
1125 log_error ("lease %s: no subnet.", piaddr (lease -> ip_addr));
1126 return;
1127 }
1128 lease_ip_hash_add(lease_ip_addr_hash, lease->ip_addr.iabuf,
1129 lease->ip_addr.len, lease, MDL);
1130}
1131
1132/* Replace the data in an existing lease with the data in a new lease;
1133 adjust hash tables to suit, and insertion sort the lease into the
1134 list of leases by expiry time so that we can always find the oldest
1135 lease. */
1136
1137int supersede_lease (comp, lease, commit, propogate, pimmediate, from_pool)
1138 struct lease *comp, *lease;
1139 int commit;
1140 int propogate;
1141 int pimmediate;
1142 int from_pool;
1143{
1144 LEASE_STRUCT_PTR lq;
1145 struct timeval tv;
1146#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1147 int do_pool_check = 0;
1148
1149 /* We must commit leases before sending updates regarding them
1150 to failover peers. It is, therefore, an error to set pimmediate
1151 and not commit. */
1152 if (pimmediate && !commit)
1153 return 0;
1154#endif
1155 /* If there is no sample lease, just do the move. */
1156 if (!lease)
1157 goto just_move_it;
1158
1159 /* Static leases are not currently kept in the database... */
1160 if (lease -> flags & STATIC_LEASE)
1161 return 1;
1162
1163 /* If the existing lease hasn't expired and has a different
1164 unique identifier or, if it doesn't have a unique
1165 identifier, a different hardware address, then the two
1166 leases are in conflict. If the existing lease has a uid
1167 and the new one doesn't, but they both have the same
1168 hardware address, and dynamic bootp is allowed on this
1169 lease, then we allow that, in case a dynamic BOOTP lease is
1170 requested *after* a DHCP lease has been assigned. */
1171
1172 if (lease -> binding_state != FTS_ABANDONED &&
1173 lease -> next_binding_state != FTS_ABANDONED &&
1174 comp -> binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE &&
1175 (((comp -> uid && lease -> uid) &&
1176 (comp -> uid_len != lease -> uid_len ||
1177 memcmp (comp -> uid, lease -> uid, comp -> uid_len))) ||
1178 (!comp -> uid &&
1179 ((comp -> hardware_addr.hlen !=
1180 lease -> hardware_addr.hlen) ||
1181 memcmp (comp -> hardware_addr.hbuf,
1182 lease -> hardware_addr.hbuf,
1183 comp -> hardware_addr.hlen))))) {
1184 log_error ("Lease conflict at %s",
1185 piaddr (comp -> ip_addr));
1186 }
1187
1188 /* If there's a Unique ID, dissociate it from the hash
1189 table and free it if necessary. */
1190 if (comp->uid) {
1191 uid_hash_delete(comp);
1192 if (comp->uid != comp->uid_buf) {
1193 dfree(comp->uid, MDL);
1194 comp->uid_max = 0;
1195 comp->uid_len = 0;
1196 }
1197 comp -> uid = (unsigned char *)0;
1198 }
1199
1200 /* If there's a hardware address, remove the lease from its
1201 * old position in the hash bucket's ordered list.
1202 */
1203 if (comp->hardware_addr.hlen)
1204 hw_hash_delete(comp);
1205
1206 /* If the lease has been billed to a class, remove the billing. */
1207 if (comp -> billing_class != lease -> billing_class) {
1208 if (comp->billing_class)
1209 unbill_class(comp);
1210 if (lease -> billing_class)
1211 bill_class (comp, lease -> billing_class);
1212 }
1213
1214 /* Copy the data files, but not the linkages. */
1215 comp -> starts = lease -> starts;
1216 if (lease -> uid) {
1217 if (lease -> uid_len <= sizeof (lease -> uid_buf)) {
1218 memcpy (comp -> uid_buf,
1219 lease -> uid, lease -> uid_len);
1220 comp -> uid = &comp -> uid_buf [0];
1221 comp -> uid_max = sizeof comp -> uid_buf;
1222 comp -> uid_len = lease -> uid_len;
1223 } else if (lease -> uid != &lease -> uid_buf [0]) {
1224 comp -> uid = lease -> uid;
1225 comp -> uid_max = lease -> uid_max;
1226 lease -> uid = (unsigned char *)0;
1227 lease -> uid_max = 0;
1228 comp -> uid_len = lease -> uid_len;
1229 lease -> uid_len = 0;
1230 } else {
1231 log_fatal ("corrupt lease uid."); /* XXX */
1232 }
1233 } else {
1234 comp -> uid = (unsigned char *)0;
1235 comp -> uid_len = comp -> uid_max = 0;
1236 }
1237 if (comp -> host)
1238 host_dereference (&comp -> host, MDL);
1239 host_reference (&comp -> host, lease -> host, MDL);
1240 comp -> hardware_addr = lease -> hardware_addr;
1241 if (comp -> scope)
1242 binding_scope_dereference (&comp -> scope, MDL);
1243 if (lease -> scope) {
1244 binding_scope_reference (&comp -> scope, lease -> scope, MDL);
1245 binding_scope_dereference (&lease -> scope, MDL);
1246 }
1247
1248 if (comp -> agent_options)
1249 option_chain_head_dereference (&comp -> agent_options, MDL);
1250 if (lease -> agent_options) {
1251 /* Only retain the agent options if the lease is still
1252 affirmatively associated with a client. */
1253 if (lease -> next_binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE ||
1254 lease -> next_binding_state == FTS_EXPIRED)
1255 option_chain_head_reference (&comp -> agent_options,
1256 lease -> agent_options,
1257 MDL);
1258 option_chain_head_dereference (&lease -> agent_options, MDL);
1259 }
1260
1261 /* Record the hostname information in the lease. */
1262 if (comp -> client_hostname)
1263 dfree (comp -> client_hostname, MDL);
1264 comp -> client_hostname = lease -> client_hostname;
1265 lease -> client_hostname = (char *)0;
1266
1267 if (lease->on_star.on_expiry) {
1268 if (comp->on_star.on_expiry)
1269 executable_statement_dereference
1270 (&comp->on_star.on_expiry, MDL);
1271 executable_statement_reference (&comp->on_star.on_expiry,
1272 lease->on_star.on_expiry,
1273 MDL);
1274 }
1275 if (lease->on_star.on_commit) {
1276 if (comp->on_star.on_commit)
1277 executable_statement_dereference
1278 (&comp->on_star.on_commit, MDL);
1279 executable_statement_reference (&comp->on_star.on_commit,
1280 lease->on_star.on_commit,
1281 MDL);
1282 }
1283 if (lease->on_star.on_release) {
1284 if (comp->on_star.on_release)
1285 executable_statement_dereference
1286 (&comp->on_star.on_release, MDL);
1287 executable_statement_reference (&comp->on_star.on_release,
1288 lease->on_star.on_release,
1289 MDL);
1290 }
1291
1292 /* Record the lease in the uid hash if necessary. */
1293 if (comp->uid)
1294 uid_hash_add(comp);
1295
1296 /* Record it in the hardware address hash if necessary. */
1297 if (comp->hardware_addr.hlen)
1298 hw_hash_add(comp);
1299
1300 comp->cltt = lease->cltt;
1301#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1302 comp->tstp = lease->tstp;
1303 comp->tsfp = lease->tsfp;
1304 comp->atsfp = lease->atsfp;
1305#endif /* FAILOVER_PROTOCOL */
1306 comp->ends = lease->ends;
1307 comp->next_binding_state = lease->next_binding_state;
1308
1309 /*
1310 * If we have a control block pointer copy it in.
1311 * We don't zero out an older ponter as it is still
1312 * in use. We shouldn't need to overwrite an
1313 * old pointer with a new one as the old transaction
1314 * should have been cancelled before getting here.
1315 */
1316 if (lease->ddns_cb != NULL)
1317 comp->ddns_cb = lease->ddns_cb;
1318
1319 just_move_it:
1320#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1321 /*
1322 * Atsfp should be cleared upon any state change that implies
1323 * propagation whether supersede_lease was given a copy lease
1324 * structure or not (often from the pool_timer()).
1325 */
1326 if (propogate)
1327 comp->atsfp = 0;
1328#endif /* FAILOVER_PROTOCOL */
1329
1330 if (!comp -> pool) {
1331 log_error ("Supersede_lease: lease %s with no pool.",
1332 piaddr (comp -> ip_addr));
1333 return 0;
1334 }
1335
1336 /* Figure out which queue it's on. */
1337 switch (comp -> binding_state) {
1338 case FTS_FREE:
1339 if (comp->flags & RESERVED_LEASE)
1340 lq = &comp->pool->reserved;
1341 else {
1342 lq = &comp->pool->free;
1343 comp->pool->free_leases--;
1344 }
1345
1346#if defined(FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1347 do_pool_check = 1;
1348#endif
1349 break;
1350
1351 case FTS_ACTIVE:
1352 lq = &comp -> pool -> active;
1353 break;
1354
1355 case FTS_EXPIRED:
1356 case FTS_RELEASED:
1357 case FTS_RESET:
1358 lq = &comp -> pool -> expired;
1359 break;
1360
1361 case FTS_ABANDONED:
1362 lq = &comp -> pool -> abandoned;
1363 break;
1364
1365 case FTS_BACKUP:
1366 if (comp->flags & RESERVED_LEASE)
1367 lq = &comp->pool->reserved;
1368 else {
1369 lq = &comp->pool->backup;
1370 comp->pool->backup_leases--;
1371 }
1372
1373#if defined(FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1374 do_pool_check = 1;
1375#endif
1376 break;
1377
1378 default:
1379 log_error ("Lease with bogus binding state: %d",
1380 comp -> binding_state);
1381#if defined (BINDING_STATE_DEBUG)
1382 abort ();
1383#endif
1384 return 0;
1385 }
1386
1387 /* Remove the lease from its current place in its current
1388 timer sequence. */
1389 LEASE_REMOVEP(lq, comp);
1390
1391 /* Now that we've done the flag-affected queue removal
1392 * we can update the new lease's flags, if there's an
1393 * existing lease */
1394 if (lease) {
1395 comp->flags = ((lease->flags & ~PERSISTENT_FLAGS) |
1396 (comp->flags & ~EPHEMERAL_FLAGS));
1397 }
1398
1399 /* Make the state transition. */
1400 if (commit || !pimmediate)
1401 make_binding_state_transition (comp);
1402
1403 /* Put the lease back on the appropriate queue. If the lease
1404 is corrupt (as detected by lease_enqueue), don't go any farther. */
1405 if (!lease_enqueue (comp))
1406 return 0;
1407
1408 /* If this is the next lease that will timeout on the pool,
1409 zap the old timeout and set the timeout on this pool to the
1410 time that the lease's next event will happen.
1411
1412 We do not actually set the timeout unless commit is true -
1413 we don't want to thrash the timer queue when reading the
1414 lease database. Instead, the database code calls the
1415 expiry event on each pool after reading in the lease file,
1416 and the expiry code sets the timer if there's anything left
1417 to expire after it's run any outstanding expiry events on
1418 the pool. */
1419 if ((commit || !pimmediate) &&
1420 comp -> sort_time != MIN_TIME &&
1421 comp -> sort_time > cur_time &&
1422 (comp -> sort_time < comp -> pool -> next_event_time ||
1423 comp -> pool -> next_event_time == MIN_TIME)) {
1424 comp -> pool -> next_event_time = comp -> sort_time;
1425 tv . tv_sec = comp -> pool -> next_event_time;
1426 tv . tv_usec = 0;
1427 add_timeout (&tv,
1428 pool_timer, comp -> pool,
1429 (tvref_t)pool_reference,
1430 (tvunref_t)pool_dereference);
1431 }
1432
1433 if (commit) {
1434#if defined(FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1435 /*
1436 * If commit and propogate are set, then we can save a
1437 * possible fsync later in BNDUPD socket transmission by
1438 * stepping the rewind state forward to the new state, in
1439 * case it has changed. This is only worth doing if the
1440 * failover connection is currently connected, as in this
1441 * case it is likely we will be transmitting to the peer very
1442 * shortly.
1443 */
1444 if (propogate && (comp->pool->failover_peer != NULL) &&
1445 ((comp->pool->failover_peer->service_state ==
1446 cooperating) ||
1447 (comp->pool->failover_peer->service_state ==
1448 not_responding)))
1449 comp->rewind_binding_state = comp->binding_state;
1450#endif
1451
1452 if (!write_lease (comp))
1453 return 0;
1454 if ((server_starting & SS_NOSYNC) == 0) {
1455 if (!commit_leases ())
1456 return 0;
1457 }
1458 }
1459
1460#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1461 if (propogate) {
1462 comp -> desired_binding_state = comp -> binding_state;
1463 if (!dhcp_failover_queue_update (comp, pimmediate))
1464 return 0;
1465 }
1466 if (do_pool_check && comp->pool->failover_peer)
1467 dhcp_failover_pool_check(comp->pool);
1468#endif
1469
1470 /* If the current binding state has already expired and we haven't
1471 * been called from pool_timer, do an expiry event right now.
1472 */
1473 /* XXX At some point we should optimize this so that we don't
1474 XXX write the lease twice, but this is a safe way to fix the
1475 XXX problem for 3.0 (I hope!). */
1476 if ((from_pool == 0) &&
1477 (commit || !pimmediate) &&
1478 (comp->sort_time < cur_time) &&
1479 (comp->next_binding_state != comp->binding_state))
1480 pool_timer(comp->pool);
1481
1482 return 1;
1483}
1484
1485void make_binding_state_transition (struct lease *lease)
1486{
1487
1488#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1489 dhcp_failover_state_t *peer;
1490
1491 if (lease -> pool && lease -> pool -> failover_peer)
1492 peer = lease -> pool -> failover_peer;
1493 else
1494 peer = (dhcp_failover_state_t *)0;
1495#endif
1496
1497 /* If the lease was active and is now no longer active, but isn't
1498 released, then it just expired, so do the expiry event. */
1499 if (lease -> next_binding_state != lease -> binding_state &&
1500 ((
1501#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1502 peer &&
1503 (lease->binding_state == FTS_EXPIRED ||
1504 lease->binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE) &&
1505 (lease->next_binding_state == FTS_FREE ||
1506 lease->next_binding_state == FTS_BACKUP)) ||
1507 (!peer &&
1508#endif
1509 lease -> binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE &&
1510 lease -> next_binding_state != FTS_RELEASED))) {
1511#if defined (NSUPDATE)
1512 (void) ddns_removals(lease, NULL, NULL, ISC_TRUE);
1513#endif
1514 if (lease->on_star.on_expiry) {
1515 execute_statements(NULL, NULL, lease,
1516 NULL, NULL, NULL,
1517 &lease->scope,
1518 lease->on_star.on_expiry,
1519 NULL);
1520 if (lease->on_star.on_expiry)
1521 executable_statement_dereference
1522 (&lease->on_star.on_expiry, MDL);
1523 }
1524
1525 /* No sense releasing a lease after it's expired. */
1526 if (lease->on_star.on_release)
1527 executable_statement_dereference
1528 (&lease->on_star.on_release, MDL);
1529 /* Get rid of client-specific bindings that are only
1530 correct when the lease is active. */
1531 if (lease->billing_class)
1532 unbill_class(lease);
1533 if (lease -> agent_options)
1534 option_chain_head_dereference (&lease -> agent_options,
1535 MDL);
1536 if (lease -> client_hostname) {
1537 dfree (lease -> client_hostname, MDL);
1538 lease -> client_hostname = (char *)0;
1539 }
1540 if (lease -> host)
1541 host_dereference (&lease -> host, MDL);
1542
1543 /* Send the expiry time to the peer. */
1544 lease -> tstp = lease -> ends;
1545 }
1546
1547 /* If the lease was active and is now released, do the release
1548 event. */
1549 if (lease -> next_binding_state != lease -> binding_state &&
1550 ((
1551#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1552 peer &&
1553 lease -> binding_state == FTS_RELEASED &&
1554 (lease -> next_binding_state == FTS_FREE ||
1555 lease -> next_binding_state == FTS_BACKUP)) ||
1556 (!peer &&
1557#endif
1558 lease -> binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE &&
1559 lease -> next_binding_state == FTS_RELEASED))) {
1560#if defined (NSUPDATE)
1561 /*
1562 * Note: ddns_removals() is also iterated when the lease
1563 * enters state 'released' in 'release_lease()'. The below
1564 * is caught when a peer receives a BNDUPD from a failover
1565 * peer; it may not have received the client's release (it
1566 * may have been offline).
1567 *
1568 * We could remove the call from release_lease() because
1569 * it will also catch here on the originating server after the
1570 * peer acknowledges the state change. However, there could
1571 * be many hours inbetween, and in this case we /know/ the
1572 * client is no longer using the lease when we receive the
1573 * release message. This is not true of expiry, where the
1574 * peer may have extended the lease.
1575 */
1576 (void) ddns_removals(lease, NULL, NULL, ISC_TRUE);
1577#endif
1578 if (lease->on_star.on_release) {
1579 execute_statements(NULL, NULL, lease,
1580 NULL, NULL, NULL,
1581 &lease->scope,
1582 lease->on_star.on_release,
1583 NULL);
1584 executable_statement_dereference
1585 (&lease->on_star.on_release, MDL);
1586 }
1587
1588 /* A released lease can't expire. */
1589 if (lease->on_star.on_expiry)
1590 executable_statement_dereference
1591 (&lease->on_star.on_expiry, MDL);
1592
1593 /* Get rid of client-specific bindings that are only
1594 correct when the lease is active. */
1595 if (lease->billing_class)
1596 unbill_class(lease);
1597 if (lease -> agent_options)
1598 option_chain_head_dereference (&lease -> agent_options,
1599 MDL);
1600 if (lease -> client_hostname) {
1601 dfree (lease -> client_hostname, MDL);
1602 lease -> client_hostname = (char *)0;
1603 }
1604 if (lease -> host)
1605 host_dereference (&lease -> host, MDL);
1606
1607 /* Send the release time (should be == cur_time) to the
1608 peer. */
1609 lease -> tstp = lease -> ends;
1610 }
1611
1612#if defined (DEBUG_LEASE_STATE_TRANSITIONS)
1613 log_debug ("lease %s moves from %s to %s",
1614 piaddr (lease -> ip_addr),
1615 binding_state_print (lease -> binding_state),
1616 binding_state_print (lease -> next_binding_state));
1617#endif
1618
1619 lease -> binding_state = lease -> next_binding_state;
1620 switch (lease -> binding_state) {
1621 case FTS_ACTIVE:
1622#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1623 if (lease -> pool && lease -> pool -> failover_peer)
1624 lease -> next_binding_state = FTS_EXPIRED;
1625 else
1626#endif
1627 lease -> next_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
1628 break;
1629
1630 case FTS_EXPIRED:
1631 case FTS_RELEASED:
1632 case FTS_ABANDONED:
1633 case FTS_RESET:
1634 lease->next_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
1635#if defined(FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1636 /* If we are not in partner_down, leases don't go from
1637 EXPIRED to FREE on a timeout - only on an update.
1638 If we're in partner_down, they expire at mclt past
1639 the time we entered partner_down. */
1640 if ((lease->pool != NULL) &&
1641 (lease->pool->failover_peer != NULL) &&
1642 (lease->pool->failover_peer->me.state == partner_down))
1643 lease->tsfp =
1644 (lease->pool->failover_peer->me.stos +
1645 lease->pool->failover_peer->mclt);
1646#endif /* FAILOVER_PROTOCOL */
1647 break;
1648
1649 case FTS_FREE:
1650 case FTS_BACKUP:
1651 lease -> next_binding_state = lease -> binding_state;
1652 break;
1653 }
1654#if defined (DEBUG_LEASE_STATE_TRANSITIONS)
1655 log_debug ("lease %s: next binding state %s",
1656 piaddr (lease -> ip_addr),
1657 binding_state_print (lease -> next_binding_state));
1658#endif
1659}
1660
1661/* Copy the contents of one lease into another, correctly maintaining
1662 reference counts. */
1663int lease_copy (struct lease **lp,
1664 struct lease *lease, const char *file, int line)
1665{
1666 struct lease *lt = (struct lease *)0;
1667 isc_result_t status;
1668
1669 status = lease_allocate (&lt, MDL);
1670 if (status != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1671 return 0;
1672
1673 lt -> ip_addr = lease -> ip_addr;
1674 lt -> starts = lease -> starts;
1675 lt -> ends = lease -> ends;
1676 lt -> uid_len = lease -> uid_len;
1677 lt -> uid_max = lease -> uid_max;
1678 if (lease -> uid == lease -> uid_buf) {
1679 lt -> uid = lt -> uid_buf;
1680 memcpy (lt -> uid_buf, lease -> uid_buf, sizeof lt -> uid_buf);
1681 } else if (!lease -> uid_max) {
1682 lt -> uid = (unsigned char *)0;
1683 } else {
1684 lt -> uid = dmalloc (lt -> uid_max, MDL);
1685 if (!lt -> uid) {
1686 lease_dereference (&lt, MDL);
1687 return 0;
1688 }
1689 memcpy (lt -> uid, lease -> uid, lease -> uid_max);
1690 }
1691 if (lease -> client_hostname) {
1692 lt -> client_hostname =
1693 dmalloc (strlen (lease -> client_hostname) + 1, MDL);
1694 if (!lt -> client_hostname) {
1695 lease_dereference (&lt, MDL);
1696 return 0;
1697 }
1698 strcpy (lt -> client_hostname, lease -> client_hostname);
1699 }
1700 if (lease -> scope)
1701 binding_scope_reference (&lt -> scope, lease -> scope, MDL);
1702 if (lease -> agent_options)
1703 option_chain_head_reference (&lt -> agent_options,
1704 lease -> agent_options, MDL);
1705 host_reference (&lt -> host, lease -> host, file, line);
1706 subnet_reference (&lt -> subnet, lease -> subnet, file, line);
1707 pool_reference (&lt -> pool, lease -> pool, file, line);
1708 class_reference (&lt -> billing_class,
1709 lease -> billing_class, file, line);
1710 lt -> hardware_addr = lease -> hardware_addr;
1711 if (lease->on_star.on_expiry)
1712 executable_statement_reference (&lt->on_star.on_expiry,
1713 lease->on_star.on_expiry,
1714 file, line);
1715 if (lease->on_star.on_commit)
1716 executable_statement_reference (&lt->on_star.on_commit,
1717 lease->on_star.on_commit,
1718 file, line);
1719 if (lease->on_star.on_release)
1720 executable_statement_reference (&lt->on_star.on_release,
1721 lease->on_star.on_release,
1722 file, line);
1723 lt->flags = lease->flags;
1724 lt->tstp = lease->tstp;
1725 lt->tsfp = lease->tsfp;
1726 lt->atsfp = lease->atsfp;
1727 lt->cltt = lease -> cltt;
1728 lt->binding_state = lease->binding_state;
1729 lt->next_binding_state = lease->next_binding_state;
1730 lt->rewind_binding_state = lease->rewind_binding_state;
1731 status = lease_reference(lp, lt, file, line);
1732 lease_dereference(&lt, MDL);
1733 return status == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1734}
1735
1736/* Release the specified lease and re-hash it as appropriate. */
1737void release_lease (lease, packet)
1738 struct lease *lease;
1739 struct packet *packet;
1740{
1741 /* If there are statements to execute when the lease is
1742 released, execute them. */
1743#if defined (NSUPDATE)
1744 (void) ddns_removals(lease, NULL, NULL, ISC_FALSE);
1745#endif
1746 if (lease->on_star.on_release) {
1747 execute_statements (NULL, packet, lease,
1748 NULL, packet->options,
1749 NULL, &lease->scope,
1750 lease->on_star.on_release, NULL);
1751 if (lease->on_star.on_release)
1752 executable_statement_dereference
1753 (&lease->on_star.on_release, MDL);
1754 }
1755
1756 /* We do either the on_release or the on_expiry events, but
1757 not both (it's possible that they could be the same,
1758 in any case). */
1759 if (lease->on_star.on_expiry)
1760 executable_statement_dereference
1761 (&lease->on_star.on_expiry, MDL);
1762
1763 if (lease -> binding_state != FTS_FREE &&
1764 lease -> binding_state != FTS_BACKUP &&
1765 lease -> binding_state != FTS_RELEASED &&
1766 lease -> binding_state != FTS_EXPIRED &&
1767 lease -> binding_state != FTS_RESET) {
1768 if (lease->on_star.on_commit)
1769 executable_statement_dereference
1770 (&lease->on_star.on_commit, MDL);
1771
1772 /* Blow away any bindings. */
1773 if (lease -> scope)
1774 binding_scope_dereference (&lease -> scope, MDL);
1775
1776 /* Set sort times to the present. */
1777 lease -> ends = cur_time;
1778 /* Lower layers of muckery set tstp to ->ends. But we send
1779 * protocol messages before this. So it is best to set
1780 * tstp now anyway.
1781 */
1782 lease->tstp = cur_time;
1783#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1784 if (lease -> pool && lease -> pool -> failover_peer) {
1785 dhcp_failover_state_t *peer = NULL;
1786
1787 if (lease->pool != NULL)
1788 peer = lease->pool->failover_peer;
1789
1790 if ((peer->service_state == not_cooperating) &&
1791 (((peer->i_am == primary) &&
1792 (lease->rewind_binding_state == FTS_FREE)) ||
1793 ((peer->i_am == secondary) &&
1794 (lease->rewind_binding_state == FTS_BACKUP)))) {
1795 lease->next_binding_state =
1796 lease->rewind_binding_state;
1797 } else
1798 lease -> next_binding_state = FTS_RELEASED;
1799 } else {
1800 lease -> next_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
1801 }
1802#else
1803 lease -> next_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
1804#endif
1805 supersede_lease(lease, NULL, 1, 1, 1, 0);
1806 }
1807}
1808
1809/* Abandon the specified lease (set its timeout to infinity and its
1810 particulars to zero, and re-hash it as appropriate. */
1811
1812void abandon_lease (lease, message)
1813 struct lease *lease;
1814 const char *message;
1815{
1816 struct lease *lt = NULL;
1817#if defined (NSUPDATE)
1818 (void) ddns_removals(lease, NULL, NULL, ISC_FALSE);
1819#endif
1820
1821 if (!lease_copy(&lt, lease, MDL)) {
1822 return;
1823 }
1824
1825 if (lt->scope) {
1826 binding_scope_dereference(&lt->scope, MDL);
1827 }
1828
1829 /* Calculate the abandone expiry time. If it wraps,
1830 * use the maximum expiry time. */
1831 lt->ends = cur_time + abandon_lease_time;
1832 if (lt->ends < cur_time || lt->ends > MAX_TIME) {
1833 lt->ends = MAX_TIME;
1834 }
1835
1836 lt->next_binding_state = FTS_ABANDONED;
1837
1838 log_error ("Abandoning IP address %s: %s", piaddr(lease->ip_addr),
1839 message);
1840 lt->hardware_addr.hlen = 0;
1841 if (lt->uid && lt->uid != lt->uid_buf) {
1842 dfree(lt->uid, MDL);
1843 }
1844
1845 lt->uid = NULL;
1846 lt->uid_len = 0;
1847 lt->uid_max = 0;
1848 supersede_lease(lease, lt, 1, 1, 1, 0);
1849 lease_dereference(&lt, MDL);
1850}
1851
1852#if 0
1853/*
1854 * This doesn't appear to be in use for anything anymore.
1855 * I'm ifdeffing it now and if there are no complaints in
1856 * the future it will be removed.
1857 * SAR
1858 */
1859
1860/* Abandon the specified lease (set its timeout to infinity and its
1861 particulars to zero, and re-hash it as appropriate. */
1862
1863void dissociate_lease (lease)
1864 struct lease *lease;
1865{
1866 struct lease *lt = (struct lease *)0;
1867#if defined (NSUPDATE)
1868 (void) ddns_removals(lease, NULL, NULL, ISC_FALSE);
1869#endif
1870
1871 if (!lease_copy (&lt, lease, MDL))
1872 return;
1873
1874#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1875 if (lease -> pool && lease -> pool -> failover_peer) {
1876 lt -> next_binding_state = FTS_RESET;
1877 } else {
1878 lt -> next_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
1879 }
1880#else
1881 lt -> next_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
1882#endif
1883 lt -> ends = cur_time; /* XXX */
1884 lt -> hardware_addr.hlen = 0;
1885 if (lt -> uid && lt -> uid != lt -> uid_buf)
1886 dfree (lt -> uid, MDL);
1887 lt -> uid = (unsigned char *)0;
1888 lt -> uid_len = 0;
1889 lt -> uid_max = 0;
1890 supersede_lease (lease, lt, 1, 1, 1, 0);
1891 lease_dereference (&lt, MDL);
1892}
1893#endif
1894
1895/* Timer called when a lease in a particular pool expires. */
1896void pool_timer (vpool)
1897 void *vpool;
1898{
1899 struct pool *pool;
1900 struct lease *next = NULL;
1901 struct lease *lease = NULL;
1902 struct lease *ltemp = NULL;
1903#define FREE_LEASES 0
1904#define ACTIVE_LEASES 1
1905#define EXPIRED_LEASES 2
1906#define ABANDONED_LEASES 3
1907#define BACKUP_LEASES 4
1908#define RESERVED_LEASES 5
1909 LEASE_STRUCT_PTR lptr[RESERVED_LEASES+1];
1910 TIME next_expiry = MAX_TIME;
1911 int i;
1912 struct timeval tv;
1913
1914 pool = (struct pool *)vpool;
1915
1916 lptr[FREE_LEASES] = &pool->free;
1917 lptr[ACTIVE_LEASES] = &pool->active;
1918 lptr[EXPIRED_LEASES] = &pool->expired;
1919 lptr[ABANDONED_LEASES] = &pool->abandoned;
1920 lptr[BACKUP_LEASES] = &pool->backup;
1921 lptr[RESERVED_LEASES] = &pool->reserved;
1922
1923 for (i = FREE_LEASES; i <= RESERVED_LEASES; i++) {
1924 /* If there's nothing on the queue, skip it. */
1925 if (!(LEASE_NOT_EMPTYP(lptr[i])))
1926 continue;
1927
1928#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1929 if (pool->failover_peer &&
1930 pool->failover_peer->me.state != partner_down) {
1931 /*
1932 * Normally the secondary doesn't initiate expiration
1933 * events (unless in partner-down), but rather relies
1934 * on the primary to expire the lease. However, when
1935 * disconnected from its peer, the server is allowed to
1936 * rewind a lease to the previous state that the peer
1937 * would have recorded it. This means there may be
1938 * opportunities for active->free or active->backup
1939 * expirations while out of contact.
1940 *
1941 * Q: Should we limit this expiration to
1942 * comms-interrupt rather than not-normal?
1943 */
1944 if ((i == ACTIVE_LEASES) &&
1945 (pool->failover_peer->i_am == secondary) &&
1946 (pool->failover_peer->me.state == normal))
1947 continue;
1948
1949 /* Leases in an expired state don't move to
1950 free because of a timeout unless we're in
1951 partner_down. */
1952 if (i == EXPIRED_LEASES)
1953 continue;
1954 }
1955#endif
1956 lease_reference(&lease, LEASE_GET_FIRSTP(lptr[i]), MDL);
1957
1958 while (lease) {
1959 /* Remember the next lease in the list. */
1960 if (next)
1961 lease_dereference(&next, MDL);
1962 ltemp = LEASE_GET_NEXTP(lptr[i], lease);
1963 if (ltemp)
1964 lease_reference(&next, ltemp, MDL);
1965
1966 /* If we've run out of things to expire on this list,
1967 stop. */
1968 if (lease->sort_time > cur_time) {
1969 if (lease->sort_time < next_expiry)
1970 next_expiry = lease->sort_time;
1971 break;
1972 }
1973
1974 /* If there is a pending state change, and
1975 this lease has gotten to the time when the
1976 state change should happen, just call
1977 supersede_lease on it to make the change
1978 happen. */
1979 if (lease->next_binding_state != lease->binding_state)
1980 {
1981#if defined(FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
1982 dhcp_failover_state_t *peer = NULL;
1983
1984 if (lease->pool != NULL)
1985 peer = lease->pool->failover_peer;
1986
1987 /* Can we rewind the lease to a free state? */
1988 if (peer != NULL &&
1989 peer->service_state == not_cooperating &&
1990 lease->next_binding_state == FTS_EXPIRED &&
1991 ((peer->i_am == primary &&
1992 lease->rewind_binding_state == FTS_FREE)
1993 ||
1994 (peer->i_am == secondary &&
1995 lease->rewind_binding_state ==
1996 FTS_BACKUP)))
1997 lease->next_binding_state =
1998 lease->rewind_binding_state;
1999#endif
2000 supersede_lease(lease, NULL, 1, 1, 1, 1);
2001 }
2002
2003 lease_dereference(&lease, MDL);
2004 if (next)
2005 lease_reference(&lease, next, MDL);
2006 }
2007 if (next)
2008 lease_dereference(&next, MDL);
2009 if (lease)
2010 lease_dereference(&lease, MDL);
2011 }
2012
2013 /* If we found something to expire and its expiration time
2014 * is either less than the current expiration time or the
2015 * current expiration time is already expired update the
2016 * timer.
2017 */
2018 if ((next_expiry != MAX_TIME) &&
2019 ((pool->next_event_time > next_expiry) ||
2020 (pool->next_event_time <= cur_time))) {
2021 pool->next_event_time = next_expiry;
2022 tv.tv_sec = pool->next_event_time;
2023 tv.tv_usec = 0;
2024 add_timeout (&tv, pool_timer, pool,
2025 (tvref_t)pool_reference,
2026 (tvunref_t)pool_dereference);
2027 } else
2028 pool->next_event_time = MIN_TIME;
2029
2030}
2031
2032/* Locate the lease associated with a given IP address... */
2033
2034int find_lease_by_ip_addr (struct lease **lp, struct iaddr addr,
2035 const char *file, int line)
2036{
2037 return lease_ip_hash_lookup(lp, lease_ip_addr_hash, addr.iabuf,
2038 addr.len, file, line);
2039}
2040
2041int find_lease_by_uid (struct lease **lp, const unsigned char *uid,
2042 unsigned len, const char *file, int line)
2043{
2044 if (len == 0)
2045 return 0;
2046 return lease_id_hash_lookup (lp, lease_uid_hash, uid, len, file, line);
2047}
2048
2049int find_lease_by_hw_addr (struct lease **lp,
2050 const unsigned char *hwaddr, unsigned hwlen,
2051 const char *file, int line)
2052{
2053 if (hwlen == 0)
2054 return (0);
2055
2056 /*
2057 * If it's an infiniband address don't bother
2058 * as we don't have a useful address to hash.
2059 */
2060 if ((hwlen == 1) && (hwaddr[0] == HTYPE_INFINIBAND))
2061 return (0);
2062
2063 return (lease_id_hash_lookup(lp, lease_hw_addr_hash, hwaddr, hwlen,
2064 file, line));
2065}
2066
2067/* If the lease is preferred over the candidate, return truth. The
2068 * 'cand' and 'lease' names are retained to read more clearly against
2069 * the 'uid_hash_add' and 'hw_hash_add' functions (this is common logic
2070 * to those two functions).
2071 *
2072 * 1) ACTIVE leases are preferred. The active lease with
2073 * the longest lifetime is preferred over shortest.
2074 * 2) "transitional states" are next, this time with the
2075 * most recent CLTT.
2076 * 3) free/backup/etc states are next, again with CLTT. In truth we
2077 * should never see reset leases for this.
2078 * 4) Abandoned leases are always dead last.
2079 */
2080static isc_boolean_t
2081client_lease_preferred(struct lease *cand, struct lease *lease)
2082{
2083 if (cand->binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE) {
2084 if (lease->binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE &&
2085 lease->ends >= cand->ends)
2086 return ISC_TRUE;
2087 } else if (cand->binding_state == FTS_EXPIRED ||
2088 cand->binding_state == FTS_RELEASED) {
2089 if (lease->binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE)
2090 return ISC_TRUE;
2091
2092 if ((lease->binding_state == FTS_EXPIRED ||
2093 lease->binding_state == FTS_RELEASED) &&
2094 lease->cltt >= cand->cltt)
2095 return ISC_TRUE;
2096 } else if (cand->binding_state != FTS_ABANDONED) {
2097 if (lease->binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE ||
2098 lease->binding_state == FTS_EXPIRED ||
2099 lease->binding_state == FTS_RELEASED)
2100 return ISC_TRUE;
2101
2102 if (lease->binding_state != FTS_ABANDONED &&
2103 lease->cltt >= cand->cltt)
2104 return ISC_TRUE;
2105 } else /* (cand->binding_state == FTS_ABANDONED) */ {
2106 if (lease->binding_state != FTS_ABANDONED ||
2107 lease->cltt >= cand->cltt)
2108 return ISC_TRUE;
2109 }
2110
2111 return ISC_FALSE;
2112}
2113
2114/* Add the specified lease to the uid hash. */
2115void
2116uid_hash_add(struct lease *lease)
2117{
2118 struct lease *head = NULL;
2119 struct lease *cand = NULL;
2120 struct lease *prev = NULL;
2121 struct lease *next = NULL;
2122
2123 /* If it's not in the hash, just add it. */
2124 if (!find_lease_by_uid (&head, lease -> uid, lease -> uid_len, MDL))
2125 lease_id_hash_add(lease_uid_hash, lease->uid, lease->uid_len,
2126 lease, MDL);
2127 else {
2128 /* Otherwise, insert it into the list in order of its
2129 * preference for "resuming allocation to the client."
2130 *
2131 * Because we don't have control of the hash bucket index
2132 * directly, we have to remove and re-insert the client
2133 * id into the hash if we're inserting onto the head.
2134 */
2135 lease_reference(&cand, head, MDL);
2136 while (cand != NULL) {
2137 if (client_lease_preferred(cand, lease))
2138 break;
2139
2140 if (prev != NULL)
2141 lease_dereference(&prev, MDL);
2142 lease_reference(&prev, cand, MDL);
2143
2144 if (cand->n_uid != NULL)
2145 lease_reference(&next, cand->n_uid, MDL);
2146
2147 lease_dereference(&cand, MDL);
2148
2149 if (next != NULL) {
2150 lease_reference(&cand, next, MDL);
2151 lease_dereference(&next, MDL);
2152 }
2153 }
2154
2155 /* If we want to insert 'before cand', and prev is NULL,
2156 * then it was the head of the list. Assume that position.
2157 */
2158 if (prev == NULL) {
2159 lease_reference(&lease->n_uid, head, MDL);
2160 lease_id_hash_delete(lease_uid_hash, lease->uid,
2161 lease->uid_len, MDL);
2162 lease_id_hash_add(lease_uid_hash, lease->uid,
2163 lease->uid_len, lease, MDL);
2164 } else /* (prev != NULL) */ {
2165 if(prev->n_uid != NULL) {
2166 lease_reference(&lease->n_uid, prev->n_uid,
2167 MDL);
2168 lease_dereference(&prev->n_uid, MDL);
2169 }
2170 lease_reference(&prev->n_uid, lease, MDL);
2171
2172 lease_dereference(&prev, MDL);
2173 }
2174
2175 if (cand != NULL)
2176 lease_dereference(&cand, MDL);
2177 lease_dereference(&head, MDL);
2178 }
2179}
2180
2181/* Delete the specified lease from the uid hash. */
2182
2183void uid_hash_delete (lease)
2184 struct lease *lease;
2185{
2186 struct lease *head = (struct lease *)0;
2187 struct lease *scan;
2188
2189 /* If it's not in the hash, we have no work to do. */
2190 if (!find_lease_by_uid (&head, lease -> uid, lease -> uid_len, MDL)) {
2191 if (lease -> n_uid)
2192 lease_dereference (&lease -> n_uid, MDL);
2193 return;
2194 }
2195
2196 /* If the lease we're freeing is at the head of the list,
2197 remove the hash table entry and add a new one with the
2198 next lease on the list (if there is one). */
2199 if (head == lease) {
2200 lease_id_hash_delete(lease_uid_hash, lease->uid,
2201 lease->uid_len, MDL);
2202 if (lease -> n_uid) {
2203 lease_id_hash_add(lease_uid_hash, lease->n_uid->uid,
2204 lease->n_uid->uid_len, lease->n_uid,
2205 MDL);
2206 lease_dereference (&lease -> n_uid, MDL);
2207 }
2208 } else {
2209 /* Otherwise, look for the lease in the list of leases
2210 attached to the hash table entry, and remove it if
2211 we find it. */
2212 for (scan = head; scan -> n_uid; scan = scan -> n_uid) {
2213 if (scan -> n_uid == lease) {
2214 lease_dereference (&scan -> n_uid, MDL);
2215 if (lease -> n_uid) {
2216 lease_reference (&scan -> n_uid,
2217 lease -> n_uid, MDL);
2218 lease_dereference (&lease -> n_uid,
2219 MDL);
2220 }
2221 break;
2222 }
2223 }
2224 }
2225 lease_dereference (&head, MDL);
2226}
2227
2228/* Add the specified lease to the hardware address hash. */
2229/* We don't add leases with infiniband addresses to the
2230 * hash as there isn't any address to hash on. */
2231
2232void
2233hw_hash_add(struct lease *lease)
2234{
2235 struct lease *head = NULL;
2236 struct lease *cand = NULL;
2237 struct lease *prev = NULL;
2238 struct lease *next = NULL;
2239
2240 /*
2241 * If it's an infiniband address don't bother
2242 * as we don't have a useful address to hash.
2243 */
2244 if ((lease->hardware_addr.hlen == 1) &&
2245 (lease->hardware_addr.hbuf[0] == HTYPE_INFINIBAND))
2246 return;
2247
2248 /* If it's not in the hash, just add it. */
2249 if (!find_lease_by_hw_addr (&head, lease -> hardware_addr.hbuf,
2250 lease -> hardware_addr.hlen, MDL))
2251 lease_id_hash_add(lease_hw_addr_hash,
2252 lease->hardware_addr.hbuf,
2253 lease->hardware_addr.hlen, lease, MDL);
2254 else {
2255 /* Otherwise, insert it into the list in order of its
2256 * preference for "resuming allocation to the client."
2257 *
2258 * Because we don't have control of the hash bucket index
2259 * directly, we have to remove and re-insert the client
2260 * id into the hash if we're inserting onto the head.
2261 */
2262 lease_reference(&cand, head, MDL);
2263 while (cand != NULL) {
2264 if (client_lease_preferred(cand, lease))
2265 break;
2266
2267 if (prev != NULL)
2268 lease_dereference(&prev, MDL);
2269 lease_reference(&prev, cand, MDL);
2270
2271 if (cand->n_hw != NULL)
2272 lease_reference(&next, cand->n_hw, MDL);
2273
2274 lease_dereference(&cand, MDL);
2275
2276 if (next != NULL) {
2277 lease_reference(&cand, next, MDL);
2278 lease_dereference(&next, MDL);
2279 }
2280 }
2281
2282 /* If we want to insert 'before cand', and prev is NULL,
2283 * then it was the head of the list. Assume that position.
2284 */
2285 if (prev == NULL) {
2286 lease_reference(&lease->n_hw, head, MDL);
2287 lease_id_hash_delete(lease_hw_addr_hash,
2288 lease->hardware_addr.hbuf,
2289 lease->hardware_addr.hlen, MDL);
2290 lease_id_hash_add(lease_hw_addr_hash,
2291 lease->hardware_addr.hbuf,
2292 lease->hardware_addr.hlen,
2293 lease, MDL);
2294 } else /* (prev != NULL) */ {
2295 if(prev->n_hw != NULL) {
2296 lease_reference(&lease->n_hw, prev->n_hw,
2297 MDL);
2298 lease_dereference(&prev->n_hw, MDL);
2299 }
2300 lease_reference(&prev->n_hw, lease, MDL);
2301
2302 lease_dereference(&prev, MDL);
2303 }
2304
2305 if (cand != NULL)
2306 lease_dereference(&cand, MDL);
2307 lease_dereference(&head, MDL);
2308 }
2309}
2310
2311/* Delete the specified lease from the hardware address hash. */
2312
2313void hw_hash_delete (lease)
2314 struct lease *lease;
2315{
2316 struct lease *head = (struct lease *)0;
2317 struct lease *next = (struct lease *)0;
2318
2319 /*
2320 * If it's an infiniband address don't bother
2321 * as we don't have a useful address to hash.
2322 */
2323 if ((lease->hardware_addr.hlen == 1) &&
2324 (lease->hardware_addr.hbuf[0] == HTYPE_INFINIBAND))
2325 return;
2326
2327 /* If it's not in the hash, we have no work to do. */
2328 if (!find_lease_by_hw_addr (&head, lease -> hardware_addr.hbuf,
2329 lease -> hardware_addr.hlen, MDL)) {
2330 if (lease -> n_hw)
2331 lease_dereference (&lease -> n_hw, MDL);
2332 return;
2333 }
2334
2335 /* If the lease we're freeing is at the head of the list,
2336 remove the hash table entry and add a new one with the
2337 next lease on the list (if there is one). */
2338 if (head == lease) {
2339 lease_id_hash_delete(lease_hw_addr_hash,
2340 lease->hardware_addr.hbuf,
2341 lease->hardware_addr.hlen, MDL);
2342 if (lease->n_hw) {
2343 lease_id_hash_add(lease_hw_addr_hash,
2344 lease->n_hw->hardware_addr.hbuf,
2345 lease->n_hw->hardware_addr.hlen,
2346 lease->n_hw, MDL);
2347 lease_dereference(&lease->n_hw, MDL);
2348 }
2349 } else {
2350 /* Otherwise, look for the lease in the list of leases
2351 attached to the hash table entry, and remove it if
2352 we find it. */
2353 while (head -> n_hw) {
2354 if (head -> n_hw == lease) {
2355 lease_dereference (&head -> n_hw, MDL);
2356 if (lease -> n_hw) {
2357 lease_reference (&head -> n_hw,
2358 lease -> n_hw, MDL);
2359 lease_dereference (&lease -> n_hw,
2360 MDL);
2361 }
2362 break;
2363 }
2364 lease_reference (&next, head -> n_hw, MDL);
2365 lease_dereference (&head, MDL);
2366 lease_reference (&head, next, MDL);
2367 lease_dereference (&next, MDL);
2368 }
2369 }
2370 if (head)
2371 lease_dereference (&head, MDL);
2372}
2373
2374/* Write v4 leases to permanent storage. */
2375static int write_leases4(void) {
2376 struct lease *l;
2377 struct shared_network *s;
2378 struct pool *p;
2379 LEASE_STRUCT_PTR lptr[RESERVED_LEASES+1];
2380 int num_written = 0, i;
2381
2382 /* Write all the leases. */
2383 for (s = shared_networks; s; s = s->next) {
2384 for (p = s->pools; p; p = p->next) {
2385 lptr[FREE_LEASES] = &p->free;
2386 lptr[ACTIVE_LEASES] = &p->active;
2387 lptr[EXPIRED_LEASES] = &p->expired;
2388 lptr[ABANDONED_LEASES] = &p->abandoned;
2389 lptr[BACKUP_LEASES] = &p->backup;
2390 lptr[RESERVED_LEASES] = &p->reserved;
2391
2392 for (i = FREE_LEASES; i <= RESERVED_LEASES; i++) {
2393 for (l = LEASE_GET_FIRSTP(lptr[i]);
2394 l != NULL;
2395 l = LEASE_GET_NEXTP(lptr[i], l)) {
2396#if !defined (DEBUG_DUMP_ALL_LEASES)
2397 if (l->hardware_addr.hlen != 0 || l->uid_len != 0 ||
2398 l->tsfp != 0 || l->binding_state != FTS_FREE)
2399#endif
2400 {
2401 if (write_lease(l) == 0)
2402 return (0);
2403 num_written++;
2404 }
2405 }
2406 }
2407 }
2408 }
2409
2410 log_info ("Wrote %d leases to leases file.", num_written);
2411 return (1);
2412}
2413
2414/* Write all interesting leases to permanent storage. */
2415
2416int write_leases ()
2417{
2418 struct host_decl *hp;
2419 struct group_object *gp;
2420 struct hash_bucket *hb;
2421 struct class *cp;
2422 struct collection *colp;
2423 int i;
2424 int num_written;
2425
2426 /* write all the dynamically-created class declarations. */
2427 if (collections->classes) {
2428 numclasseswritten = 0;
2429 for (colp = collections ; colp ; colp = colp->next) {
2430 for (cp = colp->classes ; cp ; cp = cp->nic) {
2431 write_named_billing_class(
2432 (unsigned char *)cp->name,
2433 0, cp);
2434 }
2435 }
2436
2437 /* XXXJAB this number doesn't include subclasses... */
2438 log_info ("Wrote %d class decls to leases file.",
2439 numclasseswritten);
2440 }
2441
2442
2443 /* Write all the dynamically-created group declarations. */
2444 if (group_name_hash) {
2445 num_written = 0;
2446 for (i = 0; i < group_name_hash -> hash_count; i++) {
2447 for (hb = group_name_hash -> buckets [i];
2448 hb; hb = hb -> next) {
2449 gp = (struct group_object *)hb -> value;
2450 if ((gp -> flags & GROUP_OBJECT_DYNAMIC) ||
2451 ((gp -> flags & GROUP_OBJECT_STATIC) &&
2452 (gp -> flags & GROUP_OBJECT_DELETED))) {
2453 if (!write_group (gp))
2454 return 0;
2455 ++num_written;
2456 }
2457 }
2458 }
2459 log_info ("Wrote %d group decls to leases file.", num_written);
2460 }
2461
2462 /* Write all the deleted host declarations. */
2463 if (host_name_hash) {
2464 num_written = 0;
2465 for (i = 0; i < host_name_hash -> hash_count; i++) {
2466 for (hb = host_name_hash -> buckets [i];
2467 hb; hb = hb -> next) {
2468 hp = (struct host_decl *)hb -> value;
2469 if (((hp -> flags & HOST_DECL_STATIC) &&
2470 (hp -> flags & HOST_DECL_DELETED))) {
2471 if (!write_host (hp))
2472 return 0;
2473 ++num_written;
2474 }
2475 }
2476 }
2477 log_info ("Wrote %d deleted host decls to leases file.",
2478 num_written);
2479 }
2480
2481 /* Write all the new, dynamic host declarations. */
2482 if (host_name_hash) {
2483 num_written = 0;
2484 for (i = 0; i < host_name_hash -> hash_count; i++) {
2485 for (hb = host_name_hash -> buckets [i];
2486 hb; hb = hb -> next) {
2487 hp = (struct host_decl *)hb -> value;
2488 if ((hp -> flags & HOST_DECL_DYNAMIC)) {
2489 if (!write_host (hp))
2490 ++num_written;
2491 }
2492 }
2493 }
2494 log_info ("Wrote %d new dynamic host decls to leases file.",
2495 num_written);
2496 }
2497
2498#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
2499 /* Write all the failover states. */
2500 if (!dhcp_failover_write_all_states ())
2501 return 0;
2502#endif
2503
2504 switch (local_family) {
2505 case AF_INET:
2506 if (write_leases4() == 0)
2507 return (0);
2508 break;
2509#ifdef DHCPv6
2510 case AF_INET6:
2511 if (write_leases6() == 0)
2512 return (0);
2513 break;
2514#endif /* DHCPv6 */
2515 }
2516
2517 if (commit_leases() == 0)
2518 return (0);
2519 return (1);
2520}
2521
2522#if !defined (BINARY_LEASES)
2523/* Unlink all the leases in the queue. */
2524void lease_remove_all(struct lease **lq) {
2525 struct lease *lp, *ln = NULL;
2526
2527 /* nothing to do */
2528 if (*lq == NULL)
2529 return;
2530
2531 /* We simply derefernce the first item in the list. When
2532 * it's reference counter goes to zero it will be cleaned
2533 * and the reference counter
2534 *
2535 * Get a pointer to the first item in the list and then
2536 * drop the reference from the queue pointer
2537 */
2538 lease_reference(&lp, *lq, MDL);
2539 lease_dereference(lq, MDL);
2540
2541 do {
2542 /* if we have a next save a pointer to it and unlink it */
2543 if (lp->next) {
2544 lease_reference(&ln, lp->next, MDL);
2545 lease_dereference(&lp->next, MDL);
2546 }
2547
2548 /* get rid of what we currently have */
2549 lease_dereference(&lp, MDL);
2550
2551 /* move the next to the current and loop */
2552 lp = ln;
2553 ln = NULL;
2554 } while (lp != NULL);
2555}
2556
2557/*
2558 * This routine walks through a given lease queue (lq) looking
2559 * for comp. If it doesn't find the lease it is a fatal error
2560 * as it should be on the given queue. Once we find the lease
2561 * we can remove it from this list.
2562 */
2563void lease_remove(struct lease **lq, struct lease *comp)
2564{
2565 struct lease *prev, *lp;
2566
2567 prev = NULL;
2568 for (lp = *lq; lp != NULL; lp = lp->next) {
2569 if (lp == comp)
2570 break;
2571 prev = lp;
2572 }
2573
2574 if (!lp) {
2575 log_fatal("Lease with binding state %s not on its queue.",
2576 (comp->binding_state < 1 ||
2577 comp->binding_state > FTS_LAST)
2578 ? "unknown"
2579 : binding_state_names[comp->binding_state - 1]);
2580 }
2581
2582 if (prev) {
2583 lease_dereference(&prev->next, MDL);
2584 if (comp->next) {
2585 lease_reference(&prev->next, comp->next, MDL);
2586 lease_dereference (&comp->next, MDL);
2587 }
2588 } else {
2589 lease_dereference(lq, MDL);
2590 if (comp->next) {
2591 lease_reference(lq, comp->next, MDL);
2592 lease_dereference(&comp->next, MDL);
2593 }
2594 }
2595}
2596
2597/* This routine inserts comp into lq in a sorted fashion.
2598 * The sort key is comp->sort_time, smaller values are
2599 * placed earlier in the list.
2600 */
2601void lease_insert(struct lease **lq, struct lease *comp)
2602{
2603 struct lease *prev, *lp;
2604 static struct lease **last_lq = NULL;
2605 static struct lease *last_insert_point = NULL;
2606
2607 /* This only works during server startup: during runtime, the last
2608 * lease may be dequeued in between calls. If the queue is the same
2609 * as was used previously, and the lease structure isn't (this is not
2610 * a re-queue), use that as a starting point for the insertion-sort.
2611 */
2612 if ((server_starting & SS_QFOLLOW) && (lq == last_lq) &&
2613 (comp != last_insert_point) &&
2614 (last_insert_point->sort_time <= comp->sort_time)) {
2615 prev = last_insert_point;
2616 lp = prev->next;
2617 } else {
2618 prev = NULL;
2619 lp = *lq;
2620 }
2621
2622 /* Insertion sort the lease onto the appropriate queue. */
2623 for (; lp != NULL ; lp = lp->next) {
2624 if (lp->sort_time >= comp->sort_time)
2625 break;
2626 prev = lp;
2627 }
2628
2629 if (prev) {
2630 if (prev->next) {
2631 lease_reference(&comp->next, prev->next, MDL);
2632 lease_dereference(&prev->next, MDL);
2633 }
2634 lease_reference(&prev->next, comp, MDL);
2635 } else {
2636 if (*lq) {
2637 lease_reference (&comp->next, *lq, MDL);
2638 lease_dereference(lq, MDL);
2639 }
2640 lease_reference(lq, comp, MDL);
2641 }
2642 last_insert_point = comp;
2643 last_lq = lq;
2644
2645 return;
2646}
2647#endif
2648
2649/* In addition to placing this lease upon a lease queue depending on its
2650 * state, it also keeps track of the number of FREE and BACKUP leases in
2651 * existence, and sets the sort_time on the lease.
2652 *
2653 * Sort_time is used in pool_timer() to determine when the lease will
2654 * bubble to the top of the list and be supersede_lease()'d into its next
2655 * state (possibly, if all goes well). Example, ACTIVE leases move to
2656 * EXPIRED state when the 'ends' value is reached, so that is its sort
2657 * time. Most queues are sorted by 'ends', since it is generally best
