2658 * practice to re-use the oldest lease, to reduce address collision
2659 * chances.
2660 */
2661int lease_enqueue (struct lease *comp)
2662{
2663 LEASE_STRUCT_PTR lq;
2664
2665 /* No queue to put it on? */
2666 if (!comp -> pool)
2667 return 0;
2668
2669 /* Figure out which queue it's going to. */
2670 switch (comp -> binding_state) {
2671 case FTS_FREE:
2672 if (comp->flags & RESERVED_LEASE) {
2673 lq = &comp->pool->reserved;
2674 } else {
2675 lq = &comp->pool->free;
2676 comp->pool->free_leases++;
2677 }
2678 comp -> sort_time = comp -> ends;
2679 break;
2680
2681 case FTS_ACTIVE:
2682 lq = &comp -> pool -> active;
2683 comp -> sort_time = comp -> ends;
2684 break;
2685
2686 case FTS_EXPIRED:
2687 case FTS_RELEASED:
2688 case FTS_RESET:
2689 lq = &comp -> pool -> expired;
2690#if defined(FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
2691 /* In partner_down, tsfp is the time at which the lease
2692 * may be reallocated (stos+mclt). We can do that with
2693 * lease_mine_to_reallocate() anywhere between tsfp and
2694 * ends. But we prefer to wait until ends before doing it
2695 * automatically (choose the greater of the two). Note
2696 * that 'ends' is usually a historic timestamp in the
2697 * case of expired leases, is really only in the future
2698 * on released leases, and if we know a lease to be released
2699 * the peer might still know it to be active...in which case
2700 * it's possible the peer has renewed this lease, so avoid
2701 * doing that.
2702 */
2703 if (comp->pool->failover_peer &&
2704 comp->pool->failover_peer->me.state == partner_down)
2705 comp->sort_time = (comp->tsfp > comp->ends) ?
2706 comp->tsfp : comp->ends;
2707 else
2708#endif
2709 comp->sort_time = comp->ends;
2710
2711 break;
2712
2713 case FTS_ABANDONED:
2714 lq = &comp -> pool -> abandoned;
2715 comp -> sort_time = comp -> ends;
2716 break;
2717
2718 case FTS_BACKUP:
2719 if (comp->flags & RESERVED_LEASE) {
2720 lq = &comp->pool->reserved;
2721 } else {
2722 lq = &comp->pool->backup;
2723 comp->pool->backup_leases++;
2724 }
2725 comp -> sort_time = comp -> ends;
2726 break;
2727
2728 default:
2729 log_error ("Lease with bogus binding state: %d",
2730 comp -> binding_state);
2731#if defined (BINDING_STATE_DEBUG)
2732 abort ();
2733#endif
2734 return 0;
2735 }
2736
2737 LEASE_INSERTP(lq, comp);
2738
2739 return 1;
2740}
2741
2742/* For a given lease, sort it onto the right list in its pool and put it
2743 in each appropriate hash, understanding that it's already by definition
2744 in lease_ip_addr_hash. */
2745
2746isc_result_t
2747lease_instantiate(const void *key, unsigned len, void *object)
2748{
2749 struct lease *lease = object;
2750 struct class *class;
2751 /* XXX If the lease doesn't have a pool at this point, it's an
2752 XXX orphan, which we *should* keep around until it expires,
2753 XXX but which right now we just forget. */
2754 if (!lease -> pool) {
2755 lease_ip_hash_delete(lease_ip_addr_hash, lease->ip_addr.iabuf,
2756 lease->ip_addr.len, MDL);
2757 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
2758 }
2759
2760#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
2761 /* If the lease is in FTS_BACKUP but there is no peer, then the
2762 * pool must have been formerly configured for failover and
2763 * is now configured as standalone. This means we need to
2764 * move the lease to FTS_FREE to make it available. */
2765 if ((lease->binding_state == FTS_BACKUP) &&
2766 (lease->pool->failover_peer == NULL)) {
2767#else
2768 /* We aren't compiled for failover, so just move to FTS_FREE */
2769 if (lease->binding_state == FTS_BACKUP) {
2770#endif
2771 lease->binding_state = FTS_FREE;
2772 lease->next_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
2773 lease->rewind_binding_state = FTS_FREE;
2774 }
2775
2776 /* Put the lease on the right queue. Failure to queue is probably
2777 * due to a bogus binding state. In such a case, we claim success,
2778 * so that later leases in a hash_foreach are processed, but we
2779 * return early as we really don't want hw address hash entries or
2780 * other cruft to surround such a bogus entry.
2781 */
2782 if (!lease_enqueue(lease))
2783 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
2784
2785 /* Record the lease in the uid hash if possible. */
2786 if (lease -> uid) {
2787 uid_hash_add (lease);
2788 }
2789
2790 /* Record it in the hardware address hash if possible. */
2791 if (lease -> hardware_addr.hlen) {
2792 hw_hash_add (lease);
2793 }
2794
2795 /* If the lease has a billing class, set up the billing. */
2796 if (lease -> billing_class) {
2797 class = (struct class *)0;
2798 class_reference (&class, lease -> billing_class, MDL);
2799 class_dereference (&lease -> billing_class, MDL);
2800 /* If the lease is available for allocation, the billing
2801 is invalid, so we don't keep it. */
2802 if (lease -> binding_state == FTS_ACTIVE ||
2803 lease -> binding_state == FTS_EXPIRED ||
2804 lease -> binding_state == FTS_RELEASED ||
2805 lease -> binding_state == FTS_RESET)
2806 bill_class (lease, class);
2807 class_dereference (&class, MDL);
2808 }
2809 return ISC_R_SUCCESS;
2810}
2811
2812/* Run expiry events on every pool. This is called on startup so that
2813 any expiry events that occurred after the server stopped and before it
2814 was restarted can be run. At the same time, if failover support is
2815 compiled in, we compute the balance of leases for the pool. */
2816
2817void expire_all_pools ()
2818{
2819 struct shared_network *s;
2820 struct pool *p;
2821 int i;
2822 struct lease *l;
2823 LEASE_STRUCT_PTR lptr[RESERVED_LEASES+1];
2824
2825 /* Indicate that we are in the startup phase */
2826 server_starting = SS_NOSYNC | SS_QFOLLOW;
2827
2828#if defined (BINARY_LEASES)
2829 /* set up the growth factors for the binary leases.
2830 * We use 100% for free, 50% for active and backup
2831 * 20% for expired, abandoned and reserved
2832 * but no less than 100, 50, and 20.
2833 */
2834 for (s = shared_networks; s; s = s -> next) {
2835 for (p = s -> pools; p != NULL; p = p -> next) {
2836 size_t num_f = 100, num_a = 50, num_e = 20;
2837 if (p->lease_count > 100) {
2838 num_f = p->lease_count;
2839 num_a = num_f / 2;
2840 num_e = num_f / 5;
2841 }
2842 lc_init_growth(&p->free, num_f);
2843 lc_init_growth(&p->active, num_a);
2844 lc_init_growth(&p->expired, num_a);
2845 lc_init_growth(&p->abandoned, num_e);
2846 lc_init_growth(&p->backup, num_e);
2847 lc_init_growth(&p->reserved, num_e);
2848 }
2849 }
2850#endif
2851
2852 /* First, go over the hash list and actually put all the leases
2853 on the appropriate lists. */
2854 lease_ip_hash_foreach(lease_ip_addr_hash, lease_instantiate);
2855
2856 /* Loop through each pool in each shared network and call the
2857 * expiry routine on the pool. It is no longer safe to follow
2858 * the queue insertion point, as expiration of a lease can move
2859 * it between queues (and this may be the lease that function
2860 * points at).
2861 */
2862 server_starting &= ~SS_QFOLLOW;
2863 for (s = shared_networks; s; s = s -> next) {
2864 for (p = s -> pools; p; p = p -> next) {
2865 pool_timer (p);
2866
2867 p -> lease_count = 0;
2868 p -> free_leases = 0;
2869 p -> backup_leases = 0;
2870
2871 lptr [FREE_LEASES] = &p -> free;
2872 lptr [ACTIVE_LEASES] = &p -> active;
2873 lptr [EXPIRED_LEASES] = &p -> expired;
2874 lptr [ABANDONED_LEASES] = &p -> abandoned;
2875 lptr [BACKUP_LEASES] = &p -> backup;
2876 lptr [RESERVED_LEASES] = &p->reserved;
2877
2878 for (i = FREE_LEASES; i <= RESERVED_LEASES; i++) {
2879 for (l = LEASE_GET_FIRSTP(lptr[i]);
2880 l != NULL;
2881 l = LEASE_GET_NEXTP(lptr[i], l)) {
2882 p -> lease_count++;
2883 if (l -> ends <= cur_time) {
2884 if (l->binding_state == FTS_FREE) {
2885 if (i == FREE_LEASES)
2886 p->free_leases++;
2887 else if (i != RESERVED_LEASES)
2888 log_fatal("Impossible case "
2889 "at %s:%d.", MDL);
2890 } else if (l->binding_state == FTS_BACKUP) {
2891 if (i == BACKUP_LEASES)
2892 p->backup_leases++;
2893 else if (i != RESERVED_LEASES)
2894 log_fatal("Impossible case "
2895 "at %s:%d.", MDL);
2896 }
2897 }
2898#if defined (FAILOVER_PROTOCOL)
2899 if (p -> failover_peer &&
2900 l -> tstp > l -> atsfp &&
2901 !(l -> flags & ON_UPDATE_QUEUE)) {
2902 l -> desired_binding_state = l -> binding_state;
2903 dhcp_failover_queue_update (l, 1);
2904 }
2905#endif
2906 }
2907 }
2908 }
2909 }
2910
2911 /* turn off startup phase */
2912 server_starting = 0;
2913}
2914
2915void dump_subnets ()
2916{
2917 struct lease *l;
2918 struct shared_network *s;
2919 struct subnet *n;
2920 struct pool *p;
2921 LEASE_STRUCT_PTR lptr[RESERVED_LEASES+1];
2922 int i;
2923
2924 log_info ("Subnets:");
2925 for (n = subnets; n; n = n -> next_subnet) {
2926 log_debug (" Subnet %s", piaddr (n -> net));
2927 log_debug (" netmask %s",
2928 piaddr (n -> netmask));
2929 }
2930 log_info ("Shared networks:");
2931 for (s = shared_networks; s; s = s -> next) {
2932 log_info (" %s", s -> name);
2933 for (p = s -> pools; p; p = p -> next) {
2934 lptr [FREE_LEASES] = &p -> free;
2935 lptr [ACTIVE_LEASES] = &p -> active;
2936 lptr [EXPIRED_LEASES] = &p -> expired;
2937 lptr [ABANDONED_LEASES] = &p -> abandoned;
2938 lptr [BACKUP_LEASES] = &p -> backup;
2939 lptr [RESERVED_LEASES] = &p->reserved;
2940
2941 for (i = FREE_LEASES; i <= RESERVED_LEASES; i++) {
2942 for (l = LEASE_GET_FIRSTP(lptr[i]);
2943 l != NULL;
2944 l = LEASE_GET_NEXTP(lptr[i], l)) {
2945 print_lease (l);
2946 }
2947 }
2948 }
2949 }
2950}

2952HASH_FUNCTIONS(lease_ip, const unsigned char *, struct lease, lease_ip_hash_t,
2953 lease_reference, lease_dereference, do_ip4_hash)
2954HASH_FUNCTIONS(lease_id, const unsigned char *, struct lease, lease_id_hash_t,
2955 lease_reference, lease_dereference, do_id_hash)
2956HASH_FUNCTIONS (host, const unsigned char *, struct host_decl, host_hash_t,
2957 host_reference, host_dereference, do_string_hash)
2958HASH_FUNCTIONS (class, const char *, struct class, class_hash_t,
2959 class_reference, class_dereference, do_string_hash)
2960
2961#if defined (DEBUG_MEMORY_LEAKAGE) && \
2962 defined (DEBUG_MEMORY_LEAKAGE_ON_EXIT)
2963extern struct hash_table *dns_zone_hash;
2964extern struct interface_info **interface_vector;
2965extern int interface_count;
2966dhcp_control_object_t *dhcp_control_object;
2967extern struct hash_table *auth_key_hash;
2968struct hash_table *universe_hash;
2969struct universe **universes;
2970int universe_count, universe_max;
2971#if 0
2972extern int end;
2973#endif
2974
2975#if defined (COMPACT_LEASES)
2976extern struct lease *lease_hunks;
2977#endif
2978
2979void free_everything(void)
2980{
2981 struct subnet *sc = (struct subnet *)0, *sn = (struct subnet *)0;
2982 struct shared_network *nc = (struct shared_network *)0,
2983 *nn = (struct shared_network *)0;
2984 struct pool *pc = (struct pool *)0, *pn = (struct pool *)0;
2985 struct lease *lc = NULL, *ln = NULL, *ltemp = NULL;
2986 struct interface_info *ic = (struct interface_info *)0,
2987 *in = (struct interface_info *)0;
2988 struct class *cc = (struct class *)0, *cn = (struct class *)0;
2989 struct collection *lp;
2990 int i;
2991
2992 /* Get rid of all the hash tables. */
2993 if (host_hw_addr_hash)
2994 host_free_hash_table (&host_hw_addr_hash, MDL);
2995 host_hw_addr_hash = 0;
2996 if (host_uid_hash)
2997 host_free_hash_table (&host_uid_hash, MDL);
2998 host_uid_hash = 0;
2999 if (lease_uid_hash)
3000 lease_id_free_hash_table (&lease_uid_hash, MDL);
3001 lease_uid_hash = 0;
3002 if (lease_ip_addr_hash)
3003 lease_ip_free_hash_table (&lease_ip_addr_hash, MDL);
3004 lease_ip_addr_hash = 0;
3005 if (lease_hw_addr_hash)
3006 lease_id_free_hash_table (&lease_hw_addr_hash, MDL);
3007 lease_hw_addr_hash = 0;
3008 if (host_name_hash)
3009 host_free_hash_table (&host_name_hash, MDL);
3010 host_name_hash = 0;
3011 if (dns_zone_hash)
3012 dns_zone_free_hash_table (&dns_zone_hash, MDL);
3013 dns_zone_hash = 0;
3014
3015 while (host_id_info != NULL) {
3016 host_id_info_t *tmp;
3017 option_dereference(&host_id_info->option, MDL);
3018 host_free_hash_table(&host_id_info->values_hash, MDL);
3019 tmp = host_id_info->next;
3020 dfree(host_id_info, MDL);
3021 host_id_info = tmp;
3022 }
3023#if 0
3024 if (auth_key_hash)
3025 auth_key_free_hash_table (&auth_key_hash, MDL);
3026#endif
3027 auth_key_hash = 0;
3028
3029 omapi_object_dereference ((omapi_object_t **)&dhcp_control_object,
3030 MDL);
3031
3032 for (lp = collections; lp; lp = lp -> next) {
3033 if (lp -> classes) {
3034 class_reference (&cn, lp -> classes, MDL);
3035 do {
3036 if (cn) {
3037 class_reference (&cc, cn, MDL);
3038 class_dereference (&cn, MDL);
3039 }
3040 if (cc -> nic) {
3041 class_reference (&cn, cc -> nic, MDL);
3042 class_dereference (&cc -> nic, MDL);
3043 }
3044 group_dereference (&cc -> group, MDL);
3045 if (cc -> hash) {
3046 class_free_hash_table (&cc -> hash, MDL);
3047 cc -> hash = (struct hash_table *)0;
3048 }
3049 class_dereference (&cc, MDL);
3050 } while (cn);
3051 class_dereference (&lp -> classes, MDL);
3052 }
3053 }
3054
3055 if (interface_vector) {
3056 for (i = 0; i < interface_count; i++) {
3057 if (interface_vector [i])
3058 interface_dereference (&interface_vector [i], MDL);
3059 }
3060 dfree (interface_vector, MDL);
3061 interface_vector = 0;
3062 }
3063
3064 if (interfaces) {
3065 interface_reference (&in, interfaces, MDL);
3066 do {
3067 if (in) {
3068 interface_reference (&ic, in, MDL);
3069 interface_dereference (&in, MDL);
3070 }
3071 if (ic -> next) {
3072 interface_reference (&in, ic -> next, MDL);
3073 interface_dereference (&ic -> next, MDL);
3074 }
3075 omapi_unregister_io_object ((omapi_object_t *)ic);
3076 if (ic -> shared_network) {
3077 if (ic -> shared_network -> interface)
3078 interface_dereference
3079 (&ic -> shared_network -> interface, MDL);
3080 shared_network_dereference (&ic -> shared_network, MDL);
3081 }
3082 interface_dereference (&ic, MDL);
3083 } while (in);
3084 interface_dereference (&interfaces, MDL);
3085 }
3086
3087 /* Subnets are complicated because of the extra links. */
3088 if (subnets) {
3089 subnet_reference (&sn, subnets, MDL);
3090 do {
3091 if (sn) {
3092 subnet_reference (&sc, sn, MDL);
3093 subnet_dereference (&sn, MDL);
3094 }
3095 if (sc -> next_subnet) {
3096 subnet_reference (&sn, sc -> next_subnet, MDL);
3097 subnet_dereference (&sc -> next_subnet, MDL);
3098 }
3099 if (sc -> next_sibling)
3100 subnet_dereference (&sc -> next_sibling, MDL);
3101 if (sc -> shared_network)
3102 shared_network_dereference (&sc -> shared_network, MDL);
3103 group_dereference (&sc -> group, MDL);
3104 if (sc -> interface)
3105 interface_dereference (&sc -> interface, MDL);
3106 subnet_dereference (&sc, MDL);
3107 } while (sn);
3108 subnet_dereference (&subnets, MDL);
3109 }
3110
3111 /* So are shared networks. */
3112 /* XXX: this doesn't work presently, but i'm ok just filtering
3113 * it out of the noise (you get a bigger spike on the real leaks).
3114 * It would be good to fix this, but it is not a "real bug," so not
3115 * today. This hack is incomplete, it doesn't trim out sub-values.
3116 */
3117 if (shared_networks) {
3118 shared_network_dereference (&shared_networks, MDL);
3119 /* This is the old method (tries to free memory twice, broken) */
3120 } else if (0) {
3121 shared_network_reference (&nn, shared_networks, MDL);
3122 do {
3123 if (nn) {
3124 shared_network_reference (&nc, nn, MDL);
3125 shared_network_dereference (&nn, MDL);
3126 }
3127 if (nc -> next) {
3128 shared_network_reference (&nn, nc -> next, MDL);
3129 shared_network_dereference (&nc -> next, MDL);
3130 }
3131
3132 /* As are pools. */
3133 if (nc -> pools) {
3134 pool_reference (&pn, nc -> pools, MDL);
3135 do {
3136 LEASE_STRUCT_PTR lptr[RESERVED_LEASES+1];
3137
3138 if (pn) {
3139 pool_reference (&pc, pn, MDL);
3140 pool_dereference (&pn, MDL);
3141 }
3142 if (pc -> next) {
3143 pool_reference (&pn, pc -> next, MDL);
3144 pool_dereference (&pc -> next, MDL);
3145 }
3146
3147 lptr [FREE_LEASES] = &pc -> free;
3148 lptr [ACTIVE_LEASES] = &pc -> active;
3149 lptr [EXPIRED_LEASES] = &pc -> expired;
3150 lptr [ABANDONED_LEASES] = &pc -> abandoned;
3151 lptr [BACKUP_LEASES] = &pc -> backup;
3152 lptr [RESERVED_LEASES] = &pc->reserved;
3153
3154 /* As (sigh) are leases. */
3155 for (i = FREE_LEASES ; i <= RESERVED_LEASES ; i++) {
3156 if (LEASE_NOT_EMPTYP(lptr[i])) {
3157 lease_reference(&ln, LEASE_GET_FIRSTP(lptr[i]), MDL);
3158 do {
3159 /* save a pointer to the current lease */
3160 lease_reference (&lc, ln, MDL);
3161 lease_dereference (&ln, MDL);
3162
3163 /* get the next lease if there is one */
3164 ltemp = LEASE_GET_NEXTP(lptr[i], lc);
3165 if (ltemp != NULL) {
3166 lease_reference(&ln, ltemp, MDL);
3167 }
3168
3169 /* remove the current lease from the queue */
3170 LEASE_REMOVEP(lptr[i], lc);
3171
3172 if (lc -> billing_class)
3173 class_dereference (&lc -> billing_class,
3174 MDL);
3175 if (lc -> state)
3176 free_lease_state (lc -> state, MDL);
3177 lc -> state = (struct lease_state *)0;
3178 if (lc -> n_hw)
3179 lease_dereference (&lc -> n_hw, MDL);
3180 if (lc -> n_uid)
3181 lease_dereference (&lc -> n_uid, MDL);
3182 lease_dereference (&lc, MDL);
3183 } while (ln);
3184 }
3185 }
3186 if (pc -> group)
3187 group_dereference (&pc -> group, MDL);
3188 if (pc -> shared_network)
3189 shared_network_dereference (&pc -> shared_network,
3190 MDL);
3191 pool_dereference (&pc, MDL);
3192 } while (pn);
3193 pool_dereference (&nc -> pools, MDL);
3194 }
3195 /* Because of a circular reference, we need to nuke this
3196 manually. */
3197 group_dereference (&nc -> group, MDL);
3198 shared_network_dereference (&nc, MDL);
3199 } while (nn);
3200 shared_network_dereference (&shared_networks, MDL);
3201 }
3202
3203 cancel_all_timeouts ();
3204 relinquish_timeouts ();
3205#if defined(DELAYED_ACK)
3206 relinquish_ackqueue();
3207#endif
3208 trace_free_all ();
3209 group_dereference (&root_group, MDL);
3210 executable_statement_dereference (&default_classification_rules, MDL);
3211
3212 shutdown_state = shutdown_drop_omapi_connections;
3213 omapi_io_state_foreach (dhcp_io_shutdown, 0);
3214 shutdown_state = shutdown_listeners;
3215 omapi_io_state_foreach (dhcp_io_shutdown, 0);
3216 shutdown_state = shutdown_dhcp;
3217 omapi_io_state_foreach (dhcp_io_shutdown, 0);
3218
3219 omapi_object_dereference ((omapi_object_t **)&icmp_state, MDL);
3220
3221 universe_free_hash_table (&universe_hash, MDL);
3222 for (i = 0; i < universe_count; i++) {
3223#if 0
3224 union {
3225 const char *c;
3226 char *s;
3227 } foo;
3228#endif
3229 if (universes [i]) {
3230 if (universes[i]->name_hash)
3231 option_name_free_hash_table(
3232 &universes[i]->name_hash,
3233 MDL);
3234 if (universes[i]->code_hash)
3235 option_code_free_hash_table(
3236 &universes[i]->code_hash,
3237 MDL);
3238#if 0
3239 if (universes [i] -> name > (char *)&end) {
3240 foo.c = universes [i] -> name;
3241 dfree (foo.s, MDL);
3242 }
3243 if (universes [i] > (struct universe *)&end)
3244 dfree (universes [i], MDL);
3245#endif
3246 }
3247 }
3248 dfree (universes, MDL);
3249
3250 relinquish_free_lease_states ();
3251 relinquish_free_pairs ();
3252 relinquish_free_expressions ();
3253 relinquish_free_binding_values ();
3254 relinquish_free_option_caches ();
3255 relinquish_free_packets ();
3256#if defined(COMPACT_LEASES)
3257 relinquish_lease_hunks ();
3258#endif
3259 relinquish_hash_bucket_hunks ();
3260 omapi_type_relinquish ();
3261}
